TI Anisotropic third-order magneto-optical Kerr effect
SO JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 7th Joint Magnetism and Magnetic Materials / International Magnetics
   Conference
CY JAN 06-09, 1998
CL SAN FRANCISCO, CALIFORNIA
SP Amer Inst Phys, IEEE Magnet Soc, TMS, Off Naval Res, Amer Soc Testing & Mat, Amer Ceram Soc
ID HCP; FCC; CO
AB The magnitude of the polar magneto-optical Kerr effect in reflection from thick iron epitaxial films is experimentally found to strongly depend on the crystallographic orientation of the film, with variations of more than 20%. Similar results are obtained on the (001) and (110) faces of a bulk Fe crystal. It is shown that this anisotropy can be described as a third-order effect in the magnetization M on the optical response epsilon(omega,M). Our analysis can also be used to understand the transversal Kerr effect at normal incidence recently observed by Gridnev et al. (C) 1998 American Institute of Physics. [S0021-8979(98)46611-8].

TI Exchange coupling of NiFe/FeRh-Ir thin films
SO JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 7th Joint Magnetism and Magnetic Materials / International Magnetics
   Conference
CY JAN 06-09, 1998
CL SAN FRANCISCO, CALIFORNIA
SP Amer Inst Phys, IEEE Magnet Soc, TMS, Off Naval Res, Amer Soc Testing & Mat, Amer Ceram Soc
ID FERH; TRANSITION
AB We report unusually large room temperature coercive field H-c induced in Ni0.81Fe0.19 films grown on the (001) magnetically compensated surface of antiferromagnetic single crystal CsCl-type FeRh0.95Ir0.05 alloy thin layers on MgO(001) substrates. The specimens were prepared by conventional rf sputtering in Kr atmosphere, at 450-500 degrees C for FeRh-Ir and 20-200 degrees C for NiFe. The epitaxial growth of NiFe/FeRh-Ir and atomically flat terraces of FeRh-Ir were confirmed by x-ray reflectometry and scanning tunneling microscopy. For a NiFe(2.7 nm)/FeRh-Ir(22 nm) film, a maximum H-c of 810 Oe is observed. The 1/t(NiFe) dependence of H-c for larger NiFe thicknesses indicates that the large coercive field originates from the magnetic interaction at NiFe/FeRh-Ir interface. The large H-c combined with high corrosion resistance make FeRh based alloys a promising candidate for application as pinning layers in spin-valve devices. (C) 1998 American Institute of Physics.
C1 Electrotech Lab, Ibaraki, Osaka 3058568, Japan.
   Natl Inst Adv Interdisciplinary Res, JRCAT, Higashi Ku, Ibaraki, Osaka 3058562, Japan.
   Charles Univ, Inst Phys, CR-12116 Prague, Czech Republic.
RP Yuasa, S (reprint author), Electrotech Lab, 1-1-4 Umezono, Ibaraki, Osaka 3058568, Japan.
CR DIENY B, 1994, J MAGN MAGN MATER, V136, P335, DOI 10.1016/0304-8853(94)00356-4
   Fallot M, 1939, REV SCI, V8, P498
   Kools JCS, 1996, IEEE T MAGN, V32, P3165, DOI 10.1109/20.508381
   KOUVEL JS, 1966, J APPL PHYS, V37, P1257, DOI 10.1063/1.1708424

TI Magnetoresistance in single Fe(001) ultrathin films
SO JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 7th Joint Magnetism and Magnetic Materials / International Magnetics
   Conference
CY JAN 06-09, 1998
CL SAN FRANCISCO, CALIFORNIA
SP Amer Inst Phys, IEEE Magnet Soc, TMS, Off Naval Res, Amer Soc Testing & Mat, Amer Ceram Soc
ID OSCILLATION
AB Magnetoresistance in Au(001)-sandwiched Fe(001) ultrathin films was investigated at T = 1.6 K. Effects of both the Fe layer and the Au cap layer were investigated using wedge-shaped Fe and Au cap layers. The total thicknesses of the films were kept much thinner than the mean free path of the conduction electrons in order to enhance the magnetoresistance by electron channeling between the surface and the substrate. The Fe wedge-shaped films in the range d(Fe) = 0-4 Angstrom showed a granular-type giant magnetoresistance (GMR) because of a discontinuity in the Fe layer. The films with d(Fe) = 4-25 Angstrom also showed that the GMR component through the Fe layer is continuous. In the Au cap wedge-shaped films, the GMR component nearly vanished at d(Au) (cap) = 0. The MR ratio increased linearly with d(Au cap) in the range d(Au cap) = 0-50 Angstrom and saturated at d(Au cap) similar to 130 Angstrom. Moreover, the CuO overlayer on the Au cap wedge-shaped film resulted in a 25% decrease in the MR ratio in the whole dAu cap range. These phenomena can be interpreted as differences in spin flip probability for electron reflections on the surface and at the interfaces. (C) 1998 American Institute of Physics. [S0021-8979(98)50311-2].
C1 Electrotech Lab, Tsukuba 3058568, Japan.
   Nihon Univ, Coll Sci & Technol, Funabashi, Chiba 2748501, Japan.
RP Yuasa, S (reprint author), Electrotech Lab, Tsukuba 3058568, Japan.
EM yuasa@etl.go.jp

TI Nonlinear magneto-optical response from quantum well states in an
   Fe(001) wedge
SO SURFACE SCIENCE
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 17th European Conference on Surface Science
CY SEP 16-19, 1997
CL ENSCHEDE, NETHERLANDS
DE iron; magnetic measurements; quantum effects; second harmonic generation
ID 2ND-HARMONIC GENERATION; FILMS; OSCILLATIONS; SURFACES; METALS
AB Quantum well states (QWS) are studied in a thin Fe(001) wedge-shaped layer with the help of magnetization-sensitive second harmonic generation. Unlike for noble metals, the nonlinear optical response is strongly dominated by interband transitions. The relatively small contribution of QWS to the total second harmonic response is explained by the extreme interface sensitivity of the technique, in this case related to the localization of the participating d-states. (C) 1998 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

TI Computation of J-inner-outer factorizations of rational matrices
SO INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF ROBUST AND NONLINEAR CONTROL
LA English
DT Article
DE J-inner-outer factorization; system inversion; descriptor systems;
   numerical methods
ID H-INFINITY CONTROL; GENERALIZED STATE-SPACE; SINGULAR PENCIL; CANONICAL
   FORM; SYSTEMS; CONJUGATION; ALGORITHM
AB A new numerically reliable computational approach is proposed to compute the factorization of a rational transfer function matrix G as a product of a J-lossless factor with a stable, minimum-phase factor. In contrast to existing computationally involved 'one-shot' methods which require the solution of Riccati or generalized Riccati equations, the new approach relies on an efficient recursive poles and zeros conjugation technique. The resulting factors always have minimal order descriptor representations. The proposed approach is completely general being applicable whenever G is proper/strictly proper or not, or of full column/row rank or not. It is also applicable to solve the canonical J-spectral factorization problem. (C) 1998 John Wiley & Sons, Ltd.
C1 German Aerosp Res Estab, Inst Robot & Syst Dynam, D-82234 Wessling, Germany.

TI Noise instability in nonlinear beam-beam interaction
SO NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION A-ACCELERATORS
   SPECTROMETERS DETECTORS AND ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT
LA English
DT Article
DE beam-beam effect; noise; nonlinear dynamics; emittance; diffusion
ID LARGE HADRON COLLIDERS; EMITTANCE GROWTH; DIFFUSION
AB Diffusion instability of a beam induced by random fluctuations in the size of an opposite colliding beam has been studied. It is shown, that the considered beam-beam configuration is always unstable at any value of beam-beam tune shift, if two conditions are valid: (i) beam-beam kick is a nonlinear function of coordinate and (ii) beam-beam kick is subject to noise, Meanwhile, the value of beam emittance is conserved even in the noise regime if the beam-beam kick is a linear function of the coordinate. Simple formula has been derived, which demonstrates quadratic dependence of diffusion coefficient in emittance expansion on beam-beam parameter and noise amplitude of the opposing beam size in case of nonlinear beam-beam interaction. (C) 1998 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

TI A stimulation factor for hydrolysis of ATP bound to DnaA protein, the
   initiator of chromosomal DNA replication in Escherichia coli
SO BIOCHEMICAL AND BIOPHYSICAL RESEARCH COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
ID IN-VITRO; ORIGIN; BINDING
AB Hydrolysis of ATP bound to DnaA protein by its intrinsic ATPase activity negatively controls chromosomal DNA replication in Escherichia coli. We developed a new in vitro assay system for ATP hydrolysis, which makes feasible a search for factors affecting the ATPase activity of DnaA protein. A crude cell extract enhanced the hydrolysis of ATP bound to DnaA protein, in a dose-dependent manner. Gel-filtration analyses revealed a single entity of the stimulation factor for the ATP hydrolysis and an apparent molecular mass of 170 kDa. The stimulation activity for ATP hydrolysis coeluted with the inactivation activity for DnaA protein initiating an oriC DNA replication, as determined by anion-exchange and gel-filtration column chromatographies. Activity of the stimulation factor required DNA and ATP. These observations suggested that IdaA protein, a previously described negative factor for DnaA protein, inactivated DnaA. protein through stimulation of the hydrolysis of ATP-bound to DnaA protein. (C) 1998 Academic Press.
C1 Kyushu Univ, Fac Pharmaceut Sci, Higashi Ku, Fukuoka 81282, Japan.

TI MFM observation of magnetic phase transitions in ordered FeRh systems
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Conference on Magnetism
CY JUL 27-AUG 01, 1997
CL CAIRNS, AUSTRALIA
DE domain structure; phase transition ferro-antiferromagnetic;
   magnetic-force microscopy
AB Magnetic-force microscopy observation has been performed for the domain structure in BCC FeRh, BCC FeRh0.82Pd0.18, and BCT FeRh0.24Pt0.76 alloys, which exhibit a characteristic first-order transition from an antiferromagnetic to a ferromagnetic phase at 340-420 K. The BCC FeRh and FeRh0.82Pd0.18 have in-plane magnetization and the BCT FeRh0.24Pt0.76 have both in-plane and out of plane ones depending the domain orientation. The nucleation of ferromagnetic domains in antiferromagnetic matrix and the domain growth were observed in FeRh0.24Pt0.76 during the magnetic phase transition. (C) 1998 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

TI Magneto-optical Kerr spectra of epitaxially grown Fe (001) and (110)
   films in the range 1.5-10 eV
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Conference on Magnetism
CY JUL 27-AUG 01, 1997
CL CAIRNS, AUSTRALIA
DE magneto-optical Kerr effect; Kerr rotation; Kerr ellipticity;
   synchrotron radiation light
AB Orientation dependence of MO Kerr rotation and ellipticity spectra in epitaxitial Fe (0 0 1) and Fe (1 1 0) films deposited on Au (0 0 1) and (1 1 1) plane buffer layers are reported in the range 1.55-10 eV. It is found that there is some orientational dependence in the MO Kerr spectra of the epitaxial Fe films even though Fe does not have large magnetic anisotropy. Furthermore, the shape of the MO Kerr spectrum in Fe (1 0 0) film agrees rather well with the theoretical calculation. (C) 1998 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

TI Epitaxial growth and magnetic properties of B2-type ordered FeRh alloys
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Conference on Magnetism
CY JUL 27-AUG 01, 1997
CL CAIRNS, AUSTRALIA
DE thin films epitaxial; phase transitions ferro-antiferromagnetic
AB The B2-type ordered FeRh alloys exhibit a first-order phase transition from an antiferromagnetic to a ferromagnetic stale with increasing temperature. In this study, the ordered FeRh0.95Ir0.05 alloy thin films were deposited by sputtering directly onto substrates heated above 250 degrees C. Deposition on glass and MgO(0 0 1) substrates resulted in [1 1 1]-oriented polycrystal and [0 0 1]-oriented single-crystal films, respectively. The films deposited on Al2O3(0 0 0 1) substrates were [1 1 0] epitaxial or [1 1 1]-oriented ones, depending on the sputtering conditions. Those films showed the first-order magnetic transition at about 450 K. The temperature hysteresis of the transition and the Curie temperature of the films depended on the grain size and the lattice matching with the substrates. (C) 1998 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.
C1 Electrotech Lab, Ibaraki, Osaka 305, Japan.

TI On intrabeam scattering in a heavy ion storage ring
SO PARTICLE ACCELERATORS
LA English
DT Article
DE intrabeam scattering; emittance growth rates; Bjorken-Mtingwa
   expressions; elliptic integral
AB Based on the intrabeam scattering theory of Bjorken-Mtingwa, the general expressions for the growth rates of the horizontal, vertical and longitudinal emittances are expressed in the simple form of elliptic integrals. Using this analytical approach, the blow-up of a bunched heavy ion beam in the proposed HIRFL storage ring is simulated. The time evolution of transverse emittances and momentum spread is obtained. A comparison of the results with those obtained from the extended Piwinski theory exhibits a maximum discrepancy of 30%.

TI Study on cause of internal damage of drilled GFRP (in case of small
   diameter drilling of plain woven cloth)
SO POLYMER BLENDS AND POLYMER COMPOSITES
SE KEY ENGINEERING MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Workshop on Polymer Blends and Polymer Composites
CY JUL 08-11, 1997
CL SYDNEY, AUSTRALIA
HO UNIV SYDNEY, CTR ADV MAT TECHNOL
DE GFRP; printed wiring board; drilling; internal damage; thrust force;
   dynamic force
ID DELAMINATION; COMPOSITE
AB This paper describes characteristics of the small diameter drilling of GFRP (pain woven cloth, glass/epoxy) which is copper clad laminate for PWB. First of all, the internal damage around a drilled hole is examined. Next, the dynamic force (thrust force) during drilling is measured in order to examine factors causing the internal damage around the drilled hole. Especially, the 4th harmonic component of rotation in the dynamic force is taken up, and is compared with the widths of the internal damage. The research is carried out on relation between this component and the depth of drilling in detail. As results, the outer corner of drill is one of the most important part in the small diameter drilling for the damage around the drilled hole.

TI Simulation of electron cooling and intrabeam scattering processes of a
   heavy ion beam in HIRFL-CSR
SO NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION A-ACCELERATORS
   SPECTROMETERS DETECTORS AND ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 11th International Advanced ICFA Beam Dynamic Workshop on Beam Cooling
   and Instability Damping
CY JUN 18-26, 1996
CL MOSCOW, RUSSIA
SP ICFA
DE electron cooling; intra-beam scattering; equilibrium emittance
AB This paper is devoted to the simulation of electron cooling and intrabeam scattering processes of a heavy ion beam in the proposed HIRFL-CSR, according to the analytical cooling force formulae and the intrabeam scattering growth rate expressions. Some important effects like the betatron and synchrotron oscillations, and space charge effect of the electron beam have been considered. Time evolution of beam emittances and momentum spread under joint action of the electron cooling and intrabeam scattering are shown. The dependence of ion beam properties in equilibrium on the number of particles and the electron current are presented.

TI Amounts of proteins altered by mutations in the dnaA gene of Escherichia
   coli
SO FEBS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE DnaA protein; two-dimensional polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis; gene
   expression; Escherichia coli
ID RESOLUTION 2-DIMENSIONAL ELECTROPHORESIS; NUCLEOTIDE-SEQUENCE;
   INITIATION PROTEIN; REPLICATION; CHROMOSOME; EXPRESSION; MUTANTS; ORIGIN
AB We identified proteins whose amounts were altered in a temperature-sensitive dnaA46 mutant of Escherichia coli. Proteins whose amounts were increased in the mutant were serine hydroxymethyltransferase, beta-ketoacyl [acyl carrier protein] synthase II, long-chain fatty acid transport protein, and UDP-glucose 4-epimerase, while the decreased ones were flagellin and D-ribose-binding protein. Transformation of the mutant with a plasmid containing the wild type dnaA gene complemented the phenotype, As pulse-labeling experiments revealed that the rates of synthesis of the proteins were altered in the mutant, DnaA protein may be involved in expression of these proteins. (C) 1997 Federation of European Biochemical Societies.

TI Conformational transition of DnaA protein by ATP: Structural analysis of
   DnaA protein, the initiator of Escherichia coli chromosome replication
SO BIOCHEMICAL AND BIOPHYSICAL RESEARCH COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
ID ENZYMATIC REPLICATION; CIRCULAR-DICHROISM; BINDING; ORIGIN
AB DnaA protein binds to the chromosomal origin (oriC) to initiate DNA replication. We developed an efficient system for purification of DnaA protein which will facilitate physicochemical analysis of the protein. The yield of DnaA protein was increased at least 6-fold compared to an available method being used, and over 22 mg of the protein were obtained from only 100 g of cells. DnaA protein purified by this procedure showed an indistinguishable affinity for ATP, and activity for in vitro replication of oriC plasmid. The process of denaturation of DnaA protein, which was blocked by ATP, was monitored by intrinsic fluorescence and circular dichroism. Analysis of circular dichroism revealed that DnaA protein is rich in alpha-helices, and that ATP-binding leads to a significant transition of protein conformation in that the content of alpha-helices is decreased. This is the first evidence indicating that ATP-binding profoundly affects conformation of DnaA protein. (C) 1997 Academic Press.
C1 KYUSHU UNIV,FAC PHARMACEUT SCI,DEPT MICROBIOL,HIGASHI KU,FUKUOKA 81282,JAPAN.

TI Magnetization process of a nanometer-scale cobalt dots array formed on a
   reconstructed Au(111) surface
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT Symposium E on Magnetic Ultrathin Films, Multilayers and Surfaces at the
   1996 European-Materials-Research-Society Spring Meeting
CY JUN 04-07, 1996
CL STRASBOURG, FRANCE
SP European Mat Res Soc, Ford Motor Co, Thompson CSF, YKK, Toshiba, SMI, Hitachi, Holm SI
DE nanostructures; magneto-optical Kerr effect; magnetization process;
   superparamagnet
ID FILMS; MAGNETORESISTANCE
AB The magnetization processes of two-dimensionally periodic and nanometer-scale Co dots formed on a reconstructed Au(111) surface were explored utilizing the magneto-optical Kerr effect. The magnetization processes were affected by the size of the Co dot. At room temperature, superparamagnetic behavior was observed below about 0.5 ML Co coverage, about 35 Angstrom dot diameter. A ferromagnetic transition of the whole system was visible above about 1.1 ML.

TI The magneto-optical effect of Cr(001) wedged ultrathin films grown on
   Fe(001)
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT Symposium E on Magnetic Ultrathin Films, Multilayers and Surfaces at the
   1996 European-Materials-Research-Society Spring Meeting
CY JUN 04-07, 1996
CL STRASBOURG, FRANCE
SP European Mat Res Soc, Ford Motor Co, Thompson CSF, YKK, Toshiba, SMI, Hitachi, Holm SI
DE thin films; magneto-optical effect; overlayer - wedge; Kerr ellipticity
ID KERR ROTATION; OSCILLATION; MAGNETORESISTANCE; FE(100)
AB The magnetic and electronic properties of wedge-shaped Cr(001) ultrathin overlayers grown on an Fe(001) layer were investigated using the magneto-optical effect. Precise measurements of the thickness dependence of the saturation Kerr ellipticity at room temperature show clear oscillations caused by the antiferromagnetic order and/or the quantum size effect in the Cr layer. The short period, Lambda approximate to 2 ML, was observed clearly for photon energy between 2.25 and 3.75 eV and was constant in this energy range. The long period oscillation observed from 3.25 to 3.75 eV changes its period.

TI Collinear laser spectroscopy of high-energy Li-like B-11 beam
SO PHYSICA SCRIPTA
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 8th International Conference on the Physics of Highly Charged Ions
   (HCI-96)
CY SEP 23-26, 1996
CL OMIYA, JAPAN
AB As part of the RIKEN RIBF (RI beam factory) program, high-resolution X-ray spectroscopy for highly-charged radioactive isotope beams, is proposed in order to make a systematic study of the mean-square nuclear charge radii and moments of short lived radioactive isotopes far from the line of stability. To examine the feasibility of the experiment, we are now performing a test experiment using a laser beam and Li-like ion beams from RIKEN ring cyclotron. The D1 resonance line of a B-11(2+) beam was clearly observed for the first time.

TI Disruption of the hslU gene, which encodes an ATPase subunit of the
   eukaryotic 26S proteasome homolog in Escherichia coli, suppresses the
   temperature-sensitive dnaA46 mutation
SO BIOCHEMICAL AND BIOPHYSICAL RESEARCH COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
ID IN-VITRO; PROTEIN; REPLICATION; INITIATION; ACTIVATION
AB The Escherichia coli hslVU genes encode subunits of an ATP-dependent protease, a homolog of the eukaryotic 26S proteasome. We found that the hslU gene is required for the temperature (40 degrees C)-sensitive phenotype of the dnaA46 mutant, while other soluble ATP-dependent proteases, La (Lon) and Ti (Clp), were unrelated to this dnaA46 phenotype. Disruption of the hslU gene inhibited cell growth at high temperatures. These observations suggest a specific in vivo role for HslVU protease in denatured proteins. As the absence of HslU produces minicells in M9 medium, the protease may be involved in the cell cycle regulation. (C) 1996 Academic Press, Inc.

TI Effects of the surface and interface on the magneto-optical properties
   in (Co, Ni)/Cu(001) ultrathin films
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID SINGLE-CRYSTAL FILMS; D-BAND METALS; FCC CO(001); NI; CO; TRANSITION;
   COBALT; FE; PHOTOEMISSION; MAGNETIZATION
AB The thickness dependence of the magneto-optical properties has been investigated for epitaxially grown face-centered-cubic Co and Ni films on a Cu(001) surface. An energy shift toward the low-energy side in the high-energy structure of the off-diagonal conductivity spectra of 20 Angstrom thick films is found for both the Co and Ni films. Non-self-consistent band calculations for the fee form of Co and Ni are carried out with changing lattice parameter. The calculated conductivity spectra are compared with the experimental results. The energy shift is attributed to the narrowing of the 3d band which might be due to the expansion of the atomic volume due to the lattice mismatch in the interface and the reduction of the atomic coordination number in the surface and in the interface.

TI Beam position monitoring system and COD correction at the cooler
   synchrotron TARN II
SO NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION A-ACCELERATORS
   SPECTROMETERS DETECTORS AND ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT
LA English
DT Article
ID DISSOCIATIVE RECOMBINATION; HEH+
AB At the cooler-synchrotron TARN II, light- and heavy-ion beams are stored, electron-cooled and accelerated for the research of atomic physics and accelerator studies. In these experiments, the closed orbit distortion (GOD) correction system plays an important role for improving the beam currents and lifetimes. In order to measure the position of a circulating faint beam in the ring, we developed beam diagnostic devices of high sensitivity and low noise. The beam positions can be measured with an accuracy of 0.3 mm at a circulating beam current of 1 mu A. It is the purpose of the present paper to describe details concerning the beam position monitor (BPM) system, an investigation of the sensitivities of the BPM from the point of view the S/N ratio, the experimental results of a COD correction and measurements of the accelerator parameters, such as the chromaticity and dispersion using this system.

   Yasuoka, A
TI Effects of the oxidation process on the electrical characteristics of
   oxidized nitride films
SO APPLIED PHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID SILICON-NITRIDE; DIELECTRICS
AB The effects of the oxidation process on the electrical characteristics of metal-oxide-semiconductor (MOS) capacitors were studied. It was found that electrical and time dependent dielectric breakdown (TDDB) characteristics are improved for the MOS capacitor with a wet oxidized nitride film over the N2O oxidized nitride film. The depth profile of the oxidized nitride film is also studied by Auger electron spectroscopy. It is observed that from the top surface of an oxidized nitride film of about 2 nm (nitride film oxidized in the wet oxidation process or in N2O ambient by rapid thermal processing), the level of oxygen is the same but, compared to a N2O oxidized nitride film, the level of nitrogen is greater in a wet oxidized nitride film. The improvement of the electrical and TDDB characteristics of the wet oxidized nitride film over the N2O oxidized nitride can be thought due to the increased amount of nitrogen from the top surface to a depth of nearly 2 nm of the oxidize nitride films. (C) 1996 American Institute of Physics.
RP Mazumder, MK (reprint author), MITSUBISHI ELECTR CORP,ULSI LAB,4-1 MIZUHARA,ITAMI,HYOGO 664,JAPAN.

TI Wavelength dependence of the magneto-optical properties of the
   interfaces of a Au sandwiched (001) Fe film
SO JOURNAL OF VACUUM SCIENCE & TECHNOLOGY B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 1st AVS Topical Conference on Magnetic Surfaces, Interfaces, and
   Nanostructures
CY OCT 16-20, 1995
CL MINNEAPOLIS, MN
SP USN, Off Naval Res, Amer Vacuum Soc
ID QUANTUM-WELL STATES; KERR ROTATION; ULTRATHIN-FILM; THICKNESS;
   POLARIZATION; ENHANCEMENT; WEDGE; MAGNETIZATION; OSCILLATION; MONOLAYER
AB The polar ellipticity spectra of the interfaces of epitaxial Fe/Au(001) wedges have been measured. The interface spectra resemble neither the reflection Faraday spectrum of Au nor the thin-film spectra of thin Au sandwiched Fe. The existence of low and high energy peaks suggest that magneto-optical transitions occur from and to the interface states. (C) 1996 American Vacuum Society.

TI Stochastic realization with exogenous inputs and 'subspace-methods'
   identification
SO SIGNAL PROCESSING
LA English
DT Article
DE stochastic realization; stochastic systems with exogenous inputs;
   subspace-methods identification; canonical correlation analysis
ID STATE-SPACE MODELS; FEEDBACK; ALGORITHMS; SYSTEMS; ONLINE
AB In this paper we study stochastic realization of stationary processes with exogenous inputs in the absence of feedback and we briefly discuss its application to identification. In particular, we derive and characterize the family of minimal state-space models of such processes and introduce a very natural block structure which is generically minimal. This model structure leads very naturally to 'subspace'-based identification algorithms which have a simpler structure of those existing in the literature.

TI Development of optimum process design system by numerical simulation
SO JOURNAL OF MATERIALS PROCESSING TECHNOLOGY
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 6th International Conference on Metal Forming
CY JUN 23-26, 1996
CL KRAKOW, POLAND
SP Akad Gorniczo Hutnicza, Univ Birmingham
HO AKADEMIA GORNICZO HUTNICZA
DE finite element method; optimum design; press forming; mathematical
   programming
AB Now, the development of optimum forming process design system based on computer simulation to reduce the time consumption is strongly required in the industries. In this study, the optimum process design system is newly developed in conjunction with the nonlinear FEA code and the nonlinear optimization code. In the latter code, ''Sweeping Simplex Method'' is newly proposed, which can find the global minimum. The accuracy and quickness of this method to find the global minimum of objective function, which have several local minimum points, is confirmed by comparison with the grid method.
   This numerical system is applied to the process design of complicate shaped cup deep drawing. In order to form the sheet metal with uniform thickness, ''Deviation of thickness from uniform average thickness'' is employed as the objective function, and the global minimum point in the design variable space is searched by ''Sweeping Simplex Method''. For the design variables, the heights of two punches in first stage forming are employed. The optimum process condition was determined by using this numerical code and also the validity of this code was confirmed by the comparison with the experimental observation results.
C1 OSAKA INST TECHNOL,ASAHI KU,OSAKA,JAPAN.
   DOSHISHA UNIV,GRAD SCH,KYOTO,JAPAN.
RP Ohata, T (reprint author), OSAKA SANGYO UNIV,DAITO,OSAKA,JAPAN.

TI An altazimuthal counter telescope with a magnet spectrometer tracing
   Cygnus X-3
SO NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION A-ACCELERATORS
   SPECTROMETERS DETECTORS AND ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT
LA English
DT Article
ID UNDERGROUND MUONS; SEA-LEVEL; RANGE 4; DIRECTION; EPHEMERIS; GEV/C
AB An altazimuthal counter telescope with a magnet spectrometry for use in search muon point sources (especially, Cygnus X-3) is described. The telescope is able to follow up a star and measure the arrival time, the incident direction, the momentum and the charge sign of incident cosmic-ray muons. Three runs in following up Cygnus X-3 have been performed with the telescope. We report some characteristics of this telescope and preliminary analyzed results of these runs.

TI Magneto-optical response of nanoscaled cobalt dots array

LA English
DT Article
ID FILMS; MAGNETORESISTANCE; PARTICLES
AB Magneto-optical (MO) spectroscopic studies were carried out on submonatomic layer coverage of Co atoms deposited on the reconstructed Au(111) surface forming two-dimensional lattice of nanometer scaled Co dots. TI Core-level magnetic circular dichroism in Co/Pt multilayers with varying
   Co-layer thicknesses
SO JOURNAL OF ELECTRON SPECTROSCOPY AND RELATED PHENOMENA
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 11th International Conference on Vacuum Ultraviolet Radiation Physics
   (VUV-11 Conference)
CY AUG 27-SEP 01, 1995
CL TOKYO, JAPAN
SP Phys Soc Japan, Chem Soc Japan, Japanese Soc Appl Phys, Spectroscop Soc Japan, Biophys Soc Japan, Vacuum Soc Japan, Japan Soc Promot Sci, Federat Econ Org, Commemorat Assoc Japan World Exposit 1970, JAERI RIKEN Spring 9 Project Team, Unoue Fdn Sci, Ciba Geigy Fdn Japan Promot Sci, Murata Sci Fdn, Asahi Glass Fdn, Shimadzu Sci Fdn, Watanabe Mem Fdn Adv Technol, Nippon Sheet Glass Fdn Mat Sci & Engn, Osaka Sci & Technol Ctr
HO RIKKYO UNIV
ID ANISOTROPY; RADIATION; FILMS; EDGES
AB Magnetic circular dichroism (MCD) has been studied on Co/Pt multilayers at and around the Co M(2,3) and Pt N-6,N-7 and O-2,O-3 core-absorption edges using; directly characterized circularly polarized undulator radiation. The thickness of the Co layer(t(Co)) was varied between 3 - 14 Angstrom, with an almost constant Pt-layer thickness. We have also measured the reflectivity spectra down to 4eV and have made Kramers-Kronig analyses to obtain the dielectric tenser. The orbital magnetic moment of Co is enhanced for samples with thinner Co layers. Magnetic moments are induced on Pt atoms and ferromagnetically coupled with those on Co atoms. The Co M2,3 MCD for samples with perpendicular magnetic anisotropy(t(Co) < 7 Angstrom) is markedly different from that for samples with in-plane magnetic anisotropy(t(Co) > 7 Angstrom).
C1 NATL LAB HIGH ENERGY PHYS,PHOTON FACTORY,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.
   UNIV TSUKUBA,INST PHYS,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI Collective spin waves in an ultrathin Fe wedge: A brillouin scattering
   study
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
DE Brillouin scattering; spin wave; ultrathin film; bce Fe; surface
   magnetic anisotropy
ID MAGNETIC ANISOTROPIES; SURFACE-ANISOTROPY; LIGHT-SCATTERING; FCC
   FE(001); FILMS; CU(001)
AB Collective spin waves in an ultrathin epitaxial bcc Fe(001) wedge with a maximum thickness of 8.9 Angstrom have been investigated using Brillouin scattering at room temperature. Observation of well-defined spin-wave peaks for Fe thickness d = 2.6 Angstrom confirmed a stable ferromagnetic order at room temperature. Spin wave frequencies were determined as a function of the external magnetic field up to 4.5 kOe for Fe thicknesses, 2.6, 3.9, 6.5 and 8.9 Angstrom, from which the saturation magnetization, g-factor, and surface magnetic anisotropy constants have been determined. With decreasing the Fe thickness, the saturation magnetization gradually decreases from 21.0 kG at 8.9 Angstrom to 18.6 kG at 2.6 Angstrom. We also found that the stable direction of the magnetization of the wedge under zero magnetic field turns over from the in-plane direction to the surface normal below d approximate to 3 Angstrom due to the competition between the out-of-plane surface magnetic anisotropy and the in-plane shape magnetic anisotropy.
C1 ELECTROTECH LAB,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.
   NATL INST ADV INTERDISCIPLINARY RES,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.
RP Yoshihara, A (reprint author), TOHOKU UNIV,SCI MEASUREMENTS RES INST,AOBA KU,2-1-1 KATAHIRA,SENDAI,MIYAGI 98077,JAPAN.

TI Magneto-optical transition due to a formation of quantum well states in
   magnetic ultra-thin films and multilayers
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 2nd International Symposium on Metallic Multilayers (MML 95)
CY SEP 11-14, 1995
CL CAMBRIDGE, ENGLAND
HO CAVENDISH LAB
ID KERR ROTATION; CO; ENHANCEMENT; FE/CU
AB New magneto-optical (MO) Kerr rotation (phi(K)) and Kerr ellipticity (eta(K)) peaks appear in 2.4-5.0 eV in bcc-Fe(001) and Co(100) ultra-thin films grown on fcc-Au(001) surface and the shifts towards the higher energy side with increasing Fe (Go) layer thickness are found. Oscillations of phi(K) and eta(K) as a function oi Fe or Co thickness were clearly observed by using a wedge-shaped Fe or Co samples. These types of behavior are, principally, well explained by a concept of quantum well states of Delta(1) band in the bcc-Fe (or Co) ultra-thin films. Such oscillatory behavior is unclear in Fe(110), Fe(211) and hcp-Co(0001) wedged samples.
C1 JRCAT,NATL INST ADV INTERDISCIPLINARY RES,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI Oscillation of magneto-optical Kerr effect in Co ultra-thin films
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 2nd International Symposium on Metallic Multilayers (MML 95)
CY SEP 11-14, 1995
CL CAMBRIDGE, ENGLAND
HO CAVENDISH LAB
AB The thickness dependence of magneto-optical (MO) properties are measured in wedge-shaped Co films deposited on Au seed layers by the MBE method. It is found that Co ultra-thin film on fcc-Au(100) crystallizes in bcc structure below the thickness of 6-10 Angstrom and changes from bcc to hcp structures from the RHEED observation. In 3.0-4.7 eV, new MO Kerr rotation (phi(K)) and Kerr ellipticity (eta(K)) peaks appear in Co(100) wedge sample and its shifts towards the higher energy side with increasing Co layer thickness. An oscillation of phi(K) and eta(K) as a function of Co thickness was also clearly observed. Such kinds of oscillatory behavior are unclear in hcp-Co(0001) wedges samples.
C1 JRCAT,NATL INST ADV INTERDISCIPLINARY RES,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.
   NIHON UNIV,COLL SCI & TECHNOL,FUNABASHI,CHIBA 274,JAPAN.
   SCI UNIV TOKYO,FAC SCI,SHINJUKU KU,TOKYO 162,JAPAN.

TI Core-level magnetic-circular-dichroism study of an Fe single crystal,
   Fe-Pt alloys, and an Fe/Pt multilayer
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID KERR ROTATION SPECTRA; REFLECTION POLARIMETER; CO/PT MULTILAYERS;
   ANISOTROPY; FILMS; TRANSITION; ABSORPTION; PHASES; EDGES
AB We have studied the local magnetic states of a single-crystalline Fe film, annealed and as-deposited Fe-Pt alloy films, and an Fe/Pt multilayer by magnetic circular dichroism (MCD) in core-level absorption. The MCD spectra around the Fe M(2,3) edges unambiguously reveal an enhanced 3d orbital moment in the alloys and multilayer relative to that in Fe metal. MCD signals were also observed at the Pt N-6,N-7 and O-2 edges in the alloys and multilayer, showing induced magnetic moments on Pt atoms. A comparison of the MCD spectral pattern at the Pt N-6,N-7 edges with that at the Fe M(2,3) and Pt O-2,O-3 edges gives clear evidence that the induced Pt moments are aligned parallel to the Fe moments. Fine MCD features observed at the Pt N-6,N-7 edges indicate that the Pt 5d partial density of states just above the Fermi level is higher for the majority-spin states than for the minority-spin states.

TI Fibronectin harbors anticell adhesive activity
SO BIOCHEMICAL AND BIOPHYSICAL RESEARCH COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
ID HUMAN-PLASMA FIBRONECTIN; HEPARIN-BINDING DOMAIN; III CONNECTING
   SEGMENT; CELL; FRAGMENTS; IDENTIFICATION; MODULATION; GENE; SITE
AB Effect of a fibronectin (FN) fragment derived from the carboxyl-terminal heparin-binding (Hep 2) domain on cell adhesion was studied. A 30-kDa Hep 2 fragment showed no significant effect on adhesion of Mardin Darbyn caine kidney (MDCK) cells to FN substrate, whereas after exposure to urea, the Hep 2 fragment suppressed the MDCK cell adhesion to FN in an incompetitive fashion. This anti-cell adhesive Hep 2 fragment preferentially inhibited the RGD (Arg-Gly-Asp)-dependent cell adhesion to FN. No significant binding of the Hep 2 fragment with FN was detected. Additionally, data of flow cytometry showed the presence of specific binding site for the Hep 2 fragment on MDCK cell surface. These results indicate that the Hep 2 domain of FN has a cryptic molecular region having the anti-cell adhesive activity that is probably transduced by a putative cell surface receptor. (C) 1996 Academic Press, Inc.
RP Fukai, F (reprint author), SCI UNIV TOKYO,FAC PHARMACEUT SCI,DEPT PATHOPHYSIOL,12 ICHIGAYA FUNAGAWARA MACHI,TOKYO 162,JAPAN.

TI Oxygen concentration in the top silicon layer of silicon-on-insulator
   materials formed by low-dose implantation of oxygen
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE SOI; SIMOX; oxygen concentration; SIMS
AB Oxygen concentration in the top silicon layer of silicon-on-insulator materials formed by low-dose implantation of oxygen has been measured by means of secondary ion mass spectroscopy. A value of less than 1 x 10(17) atoms/cm(3) has been obtained. We propose that the oxygen concentration in the top silicon layer is controlled by oxygen out-diffusion during the wafer cooling process.

TI Tetrasodium P-1,P-4-bis(5'-adenosyl)-tetraphosphate dodecahydrate
SO ACTA CRYSTALLOGRAPHICA SECTION C-CRYSTAL STRUCTURE COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
ID NUCLEOTIDES
AB The title compound, 4Na(+).C20H24N10O19P4-.12H(2)O, was found to be the dodecahydrate. The two ribose rings adopt the 3'-endo envelope conformation, with the glycosyl linkage anti. The exocyclic side chains have the g conformation. The crystal structure is stabilized by interactions involving the Na+ ions and hydrogen bonds.

TI Epitaxial growth and magneto-optical study of
   ferromagnetic-MnSb/antiferromagnetic-MnTe heterostructures
SO JOURNAL OF CRYSTAL GROWTH
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 7th International Conference on II-VI Compounds and Devices
CY AUG 13-18, 1995
CL EDINBURGH, SCOTLAND
SP Heriot Watt Univ, Lothian & Edinburgh Enterprise Ltd, City Edinburgh, VG Semicon Ltd, EPI, Sony Corp, Megatech, Compound Semiconductor Magazine, III Vs Rev, Johnson Matthey, Oxford Appl Res, Thomas Swan, Spectra Phys
HO HERIOT WATT UNIV
ID ZINCBLENDE MNTE; FILMS; EPILAYERS; GAAS
AB Heteroepitaxial ferromagnetic thin films of NiAs-type MnSb have been successfully grown on antiferromagnetic zincblende MnTe layers by molecular beam epitaxy. It was found that the growth-orientation of the MnSb film changed depending on the crystal-orientation of the MnTe layer: (1 (1) over bar 02) for (001) MnTe and (0001) for(111) MnTe, respectively. The magneto-optical spectrum of the heterostructure is also shown. The effect on the temperature dependence of the spectrum by the antiferromagnetic transition of the MnTe layer was observed.

TI Stability of vertical fluid-conveying pipes having the lower end
   immersed in fluid
SO JSME INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL SERIES B-FLUIDS AND THERMAL ENGINEERING
LA English
DT Article
DE vibration coupled with fluid motion; stability; flutter; fluid-conveying
   pipe; Galerkin method
AB This paper concerns a beam-type flutter of vertical pipes containing a flowing fluid and having the lower end immersed in fluid, The effect of surrounding fluid on motions of the pipe is assumed as a mass added to the immersed part of the pipe. The equivalent added mass is estimated using Morison's formula. The effects of the immersed length of the pipe on the critical flutter velocity are investigated. It is predicted theoretically that the lower end immersed in fluid may exert a considerable destabilizing effect, except in the case where the lower end is only slightly immersed in fluid and the mass ratio is as high as 0.75. Experiments with silicone-rubber tubes conveying water were conducted to check the theoretical predictions. It was confirmed that for sufficiently high flow velocities the tube was subject to violent flutter, and that the critical flutter velocity decreased with increasing immersed length of the lower end.

TI STM observation of grain boundaries in Al-Mg2Si base alloy deformed at
   room temperature
SO ALUMINIUM ALLOYS: THEIR PHYSICAL AND MECHANICAL PROPERTIES, PTS 1-3
SE MATERIALS SCIENCE FORUM
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 5th International Conference on Aluminium Alloys - Their Physical and
   Mechanical Properties (ICAA5)
CY JUL 01-05, 1996
CL GRENOBLE, FRANCE
SP Soc Francaise Met & Mat, Inst Natl Polytech Grenoble
DE AL-Mg-Si alloy; intergranular fracture; fold; Scanning Tunneling
   Microscopy
AB Surface topographies during tensile deformation at near grain boundaries were examined by Scanning Tunneling Microscopy (STM) in large- and small-grained Al-1.0mass%Mg2Si-0.4mass%Si alloy specimens having intergranular fracture. In both specimens, the steps at grain boundaries and the slidings of grain boundaries parallel to the specimen surface were observed. The height of the steps and the amount of slidings increased with the deformation. When either a step or a sliding occurred at a grain boundary, a fold was yielded at the triple point and had an individually different feature of surface topography. Frequency of fold formation with the amount of deformation in small-grained specimen was much lower than that of large-grained one. And the direction of the maximum resolved shear stress on a grain boundary plane is close to the moving direction of the grain boundary.

AU Katayama, T

TI (J,J')-spectral factorization and conjugation for discrete-time
   descriptor system
SO CIRCUITS SYSTEMS AND SIGNAL PROCESSING
LA English
DT Article
ID H-INFINITY CONTROL; NORM
AB This paper considers a (J, J')-spectral factorization of a signed spectral matrix associated with a discrete-time improper transfer matrix by using the descriptor system representation and the generalized algebraic Riccati equation (GARE). Under the assumption that the improper transfer matrix is stable, a numerical algorithm for (J, J')-spectral factorization is developed based on solutions of the generalized eigenvalue problem (GEP) and a related matrix equation. For an unstable transfer matrix, a J-unitary conjugation method is applied to obtain a stable transfer matrix generating the same signed spectral matrix. Then a Hankel norm model reduction problem is briefly discussed. A simple example is also included to illustrate the numerical procedure.

TI Uptake and excretion of cobalt in the crustacean Portunus
   trituberculatus (Retracted article. See vol. 269, pg. 1168, 2011)
SO NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION B-BEAM
   INTERACTIONS WITH MATERIALS AND ATOMS
LA English
DT Article
AB An experimental study of the uptake of trace elements from water was undertaken to develop a technique for setting labelled crab (Portunus trituberculatus) fry free in the sea. Ten elements, Mn, Co, Cs, La, Pr, Sm, Eu, Gd, Dy and Ho, were used for the test. Three concentrations, 0.1, 0.01 and 0.001 ppm, were used for each element, and mixtures of all 10 elements with the same concentration were used. Fry were reared in water containing the 10 added elements for two weeks, living crabs were sampled just after the end of marking, and after one month natural rearing. The intake of elements was then studied by NAA. The intake of elements was successful and no effects on the survival rate and growth were detected. Just after the marking period and sample preparation, the concentrations of elements taken into and adsorbed onto living crabs reflect the concentrations applied, and after one month of natural rearing, there were no significant differences between the treated crabs and the controls. Marking crustacea with elements in this manner has not yet been shown to be unrealistic. It was found that there is a large volatile component of Co compounds that is missed by normal measurement methods in the early stages of neutron activation gamma-ray measurement. The non-volatile Co compound component reflected treated concentrations. The volatile Co compound component is thought to be derived from organic Co chelates (e.g., vitamin B-12) which are essential for living tissue. On the other hand, the non-volatile Co compound component is thought to originate from the inorganic Co compound CoCl2 which was added for the marking experiments.
C1 OSAKA PREFECTURAL FISHERIES EXPT STN, MISAKI, OSAKA 59903, JAPAN.

TI SOJOURN TIME ANALYSIS FOR A CYCLIC-SERVICE TANDEM QUEUING MODEL WITH
   GENERAL DECREMENTING SERVICE
SO MATHEMATICAL AND COMPUTER MODELLING
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT Australian/Japan Workshop on Stochastic Models in Engineering,
   Technology and Management on the Gold Coast
CY JUL 14-16, 1994
CL BRISBANE, AUSTRALIA
SP Technol Management Ctr, Austr Soc Operat Res, Queensland Branch, Stat Soc Austr, Ind Section
DE GENERAL DECREMENTING SERVICE; CYCLIC-SERVICE TANDEM QUEUE; SOJOURN TIME
   DISTRIBUTION
ID OPTIMIZATION
AB A sojourn time analysis is provided for a cyclic-service tandem queue with general decrementing service which operates as follows: starting once a service of queue 1 in the first stage, a single server continues serving messages in queue 1 until either queue 1 becomes empty, or the number of messages decreases to Ic less than that found upon the server's last arrival at queue 1, whichever occurs first, where 1 less than or equal to k less than or equal to infinity. After service completion in queue 1, the server switches over to queue 2 in the second stage and serves all messages in queue 2 until it becomes empty. It is assumed that an arrival stream is Poissonian, message service times at each stage are generally distributed, and switch-over times are zero. This paper analyzes joint queue-length distributions and message sojourn time distributions.
RP KATAYAMA, T (reprint author), TOYAMA PREFECTURAL UNIV,FAC ENGN,KOSUGI,TOYAMA 93903,JAPAN.

TI THE MAGNETOOPTICAL QUANTUM-SIZE EFFECT OF ULTRA-THIN EPITAXIAL FE FILMS
SO OPTOELECTRONICS-DEVICES AND TECHNOLOGIES
LA English
DT Article
DE MAGNETOOPTICAL EFFECT; QUANTUM WELL STATE; MAGNETIC THIN FILM; EPITAXY
ID NOBLE-METALS; EXCHANGE; OSCILLATIONS; MULTILAYERS; GROWTH
AB Recent progress of our studies on the magneto-optical (MO) properties of ultra-thin epitaxial magnetic films is reported. The MO effect, which is used to read magnetic memory dots on MO recording disks, can be enhanced by the quantum size effect in magnetic ultra-thin films. This is due to a singularity of the density of states related to the formation of quantum well states in the ferromagnetic ultra-thin films.

   NAGASAWA, M
TI HIGH-PRECISION TRACKING CONTROL-SYSTEM FOR DIGITAL VIDEO DISK PLAYERS
SO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON CONSUMER ELECTRONICS
LA English
DT Article
AB The advent of digital video disks (DVD) has lead to narrower tracks along with a demand for higher density in the field of optical disks. This general and recent trend requires the improvement of follow-up capability within limits which are not detrimental to stability and speed of response. We have developed a new adaptive repetition control system that can improve followup capability by applying repetition control theory to tracking control, and which can change the learning capacity according to such nonperiodic components as insufficient stability margin (one of the problems in repetition control), disk drive vibration and disk defects, in response to the degree of track correlation. Furthermore, the division of the learning portion into two stages, namely long-term and short-term storage memories, compensates for the short-term memory being degraded by insufficient correlation and enhance the learning capability when disturbance occurs. As a result we were able to reduce the track error by disk eccentricity down to 0.02 mu m or less in a DVD disk with an eccentricity similar to compact disks (CD), and can confirm that the disk functions in a stable fashion even with interference from irregular disturbances.

TI FABRICATION AND MAGNETOOPTICAL PROPERTIES OF EPITAXIAL FERROMAGNETIC
   MN1-XSB THIN-FILMS GROWN ON GAAS AND SAPPHIRE
SO JOURNAL OF CRYSTAL GROWTH
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 8th International Conference on Molecular Beam Epitaxy
CY AUG 29-SEP 02, 1994
CL TOYONAKA, JAPAN
SP Japan Soc Appl Phys, Electrochem Soc Japan, Inst Elect Engineers Japan, Inst Electr Informat & Commun Engineers, Japanese Assoc Crystal Growth, Phys soc Japan, Surface Sci Soc Japan, Vacuum Soc Japan
ID MNSB
AB We succeeded in growing epitaxial ferromagnetic Mn1-xSb thin films by molecular beam epitaxy (MBE). The crystal structures were of NiAs-type and their orientations changed depending on the substrate, (10.1) for (001) GaAs and (00.1) for (00.1) sapphire, The sharp X-ray diffraction patterns showed that these epitaxially grown films were of the highest crystal quality reported so far. Under the present growth conditions, the compositions I of the films were automatically settled to be about 0.2 (Mn0.8Sb) which was determined by electron probe microanalysis and Auger analysis. The Curie temperature, T-C, was about 620 K, which was evaluated by the temperature dependence of the magnetization of the film grown on the GaAs substrate, The polar magneto-optical Kerr rotation spectrum of the film on the GaAs substrate was almost the same as that reported previously in the bulk samples. However, the spectrum of the (10.1) film on the GaAs substrate revealed a clearly different structure compared with that of the (00.1) film on the sapphire substrate.

TI DYNAMIC STRESS-ANALYSIS OF FRACTURE CALLUS
SO JSME INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL SERIES A-MECHANICS AND MATERIAL ENGINEERING
LA English
DT Article
DE BIOMECHANICS; BIOMATERIALS; COMPOSITE MATERIAL; INTELLIGENT MATERIAL;
   STRESS WAVE; MECHANICAL IMPEDANCE
AB A fracture callus changes in structural characteristics in response to changes in the dynamic loading condition during the fracture hearing process. The purpose of this research is to understand the behavior of the intelligent material system during the process. In this paper, the stress wave propagation behavior of the fracture callus is investigated using finite-element analysis to estimate the structural change. It was concluded from the numerical result that the structural changes of the fracture callus relate closely to the differences in mechanical impedances between the constitutive materials in the callus. The result was experimentally verified by means of the fracture model using the femur of a rat.

TI FORMING-LIMIT ANALYSIS OF HEMISPHERICAL-PUNCH STRETCHING USING THE
   3-DIMENSIONAL FINITE-ELEMENT METHOD
SO JOURNAL OF MATERIALS PROCESSING TECHNOLOGY
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 2nd International Conference on Numerical Simulation of 3-D Sheet Metal
   Forming Processes (NUMISHEET 93)
CY AUG 31-SEP 02, 1993
CL ISEHARA, JAPAN
AB The deformation analysis of hemispherical-punch stretching was performed using the three-dimensional finite-element program ''ROBUST''. The effects of the material properties on strain distribution and histories of the deformation processes were investigated. Using FE-calculation results and forming-limit curves proposed by Storen and Rice, the limiting cup height and rupture location were predicted for mild steel, high-strength steels, austenitic stainless steel and aluminum alloy. The calculated values agree very well with the experimental data. The results can be expected to contribute to predictive evaluation of material performance using computer simulation.

TI QUANTITATIVE STRUCTURE-HYDROPHOBICITY AND
   STRUCTURE-ACTIVITY-RELATIONSHIPS OF ANTIBACTERIAL GRAMICIDIN-S ANALOGS
SO JOURNAL OF PHARMACEUTICAL SCIENCES
LA English
DT Article
ID SIDE-CHAINS; SUBSTITUENT; DIPEPTIDES; PARAMETERS; MEMBRANE; BEHAVIOR;
   PHASE
AB The structure-hydrophobicity-antibacterial activity relationships of gramicidin S and its analogs retaining a beta-pleated sheet structure were examined quantitatively with physicochemical substituent and molecular parameters using regression analyses. Variations in their apparent hydrophobicity in an octanol/buffer (pH 7) system, log P'(O/W), were analyzed in terms of the ''effective'' hydrophobicity and steric parameters of side chain substituents of residues at certain positions in the molecule; however, some of the conformational factors have not been fully defined. For the partitioning into liposomes and the growth inhibitory activity against species of Gram-positive bacteria, the log P'(O/W) value simulated the hydrophobic effects of gramicidin S and its analogs better than substituent parameters. The side chain hydrophobicity was assumed to work together with effects attributed to variations in the entire cyclic peptide structure including conformational components undefined in the structure-log P'(O/W) analysis in these activities.

TI DISK-SHAPED STACKED CAPACITOR CELL FOR 256-MB DYNAMIC RANDOM-ACCESS
   MEMORY
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article
DE DRAM; MEMORY CELL; SILICON; STACKED CAPACITOR
AB A new cell structure using the disk-shaped stacked capacitor is proposed for 256 Mb dynamic random-access memory (DRAM). This capacitor structure is formed on the sidewall of a cylindrical storage node by means of a self-alignment method. The lithographic process of the disk-shaped storage node is the same as that of the cylindrical one. The distance between adjacent storage node patterns of 0.1 mu m can be realized beyond the limits set by lithographic resolution. It is estimated that the capacitance of 25 fF/cell can be obtained in the 0.4 mu m storage node height in a 0.72 mu m(2) cell area. The disk-shaped stacked capacitor, to which ON dielectric film (t(eq) = 4 or 5 nm) is applied, is investigated with regard to electrical characteristics.
RP MORIHARA, T (reprint author), MITSUBISHI ELECTR CORP,ULSI LAB,4-1 MIZUHARA,ITAMI,HYOGO 664,JAPAN.
CR MORIHARA T, 1993, OYO BUTURI, V40, P683

TI A SPECTRAL FACTORIZATION ALGORITHM FOR DISCRETE-TIME DESCRIPTOR SYSTEMS
   VIA GENERALIZED EIGENPROBLEMS
SO LINEAR ALGEBRA AND ITS APPLICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
ID H-INFINITY
AB This paper considers a factorization of discrete-time improper spectral matrices using the generalized eigenproblem (GEP) approach. We first derive a factorization algorithm for the spectral matrix formed by an RH(infinity) transfer matrix based on the GEP associated with a descriptor representation of the spectral matrix and a related linear equation. We then extend the factorization algorithm to the case where the spectral matrix is formed by an improper RL(infinity) matrix. A simple example is included to show the applicability of the present algorithm.
RP KATAYAMA, T (reprint author), KYOTO UNIV, FAC ENGN, DEPT APPL MATH & PHYS, KYOTO 60601, JAPAN.

TI QUANTITATIVE-ANALYSES OF THE STRUCTURE-HYDROPHOBICITY RELATIONSHIP FAR
   N-ACETYL DIPEPTIDE AND TRIPEPTIDE AMIDES
SO JOURNAL OF PHARMACEUTICAL SCIENCES
LA English
DT Article
ID UNIONIZABLE SIDE-CHAINS; ALIPHATIC-AMINES; STERIC PARAMETER;
   SUBSTITUENT; PEPTIDES; DIPEPTIDES; DEFINITION
AB The partition coefficient (P) of neutral species and the apparent partition ratio (P') at pH 7 of the ionized form were measured with the 1-octanol/water system for a number of N-acetyl di- and tripeptide amides having un-ionizable and ionizable side chains. Their log values were studied in terms of free-energy-related substituent and substructural parameters using regression analysis to give correlation equations of high quality physicochemically as well as statistically. The intrinsic hydrophobicity of side-chain substituents and their steric effect on the relative solvation of the backbone CONH groups were significant in determining the log P values of the un-ionizable acetyl peptide amides. For the log P value of peptides with polar side-chain substituents, respective indicator variable terms were required to account for the sum of specific effects of substituents such as intramolecular hydrogen-bond formation and the ''polar proximity factor'' for augmentation of the hydrophobicity. For the log P'(pH 7) value of basic and acidic peptides, the ability of counterionic species to form ion-pairs, the change in the apparent hydrophobicity of ionizable groups from the intrinsic value for their nonionized forms, the effect of ion-pairing itself, and other effects were additionally considered. From the regression coefficients of the parameter terms in correlation equations an effective hydrophobicity index was defined for each side chain, and the application and its limitation were suggested.
RP AKAMATSU, M (reprint author), KYOTO UNIV,DEPT AGR CHEM,KYOTO 60601,JAPAN.
CR ABRAHAM DJ, 1987, PROTEINS, V2, P130, DOI 10.1002/prot.340020207

TI CHANGE OF MAGNETOOPTICAL KERR ROTATION DUR TO INTERLAYER THICKNESS IN
   MAGNETICALLY COUPLED FILMS WITH NOBLE-METAL WEDGE
SO JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 38th Annual Conference on Magnetism and Magnetic Materials (MMM 93)
CY NOV 15-18, 1993
CL MINNEAPOLIS, MN
SP AMER INST PHYS, MAGNET SOC, IEEE, MINERALS MET & MAT SOC, AMER SOC TESTING & MAT, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, AMER CERAM SOC
ID QUANTUM-WELL STATES
AB An intensity oscillation of the saturation polar Kerr rotation phi(K) due to interlayer thickness d was observed in Fe(5 angstrom)/Au(d angstrom)/Fe(5 angstrom)(100) and Fe(6 angstrom)/Au(d angstrom)/Fe(6 angstrom)(100) sandwiched films. The periods of the oscillation are about 7-8 and 5-6 monolayers of Au thickness, respectively. The oscillation of phi(K) can be observed only in the photon energy range 2.5-3.8 eV for Fe(6 angstrom)/Au(d angstrom)Fe(6 angstrom). These phenomena are considered to be closely related to a formation of spin-polarized quantum-well states of the minority DELTA1 band in the Au layer sandwiched with two Fe barrier layers. The phi(K) peak positions and oscillation period do not correspond exactly to those of the change in the in-plane saturation field H(s).
C1 NATL INST ADV INTERDISCIPLINARY RES,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.
   NIHON UNIV,DEPT SCI & TECHNOL,FUNABASHI,CHIBA 274,JAPAN.

TI PHOTOENHANCED MOCVD OF PBZRXTI1-XO3 THIN-FILMS
SO APPLIED SURFACE SCIENCE
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 1st International Conference on Photo-Excited Processes and Applications
CY OCT 13-15, 1993
CL SENDAI, JAPAN
SP JAPAN SOC APPL PHYS, PRIORITY AREA RES PHOTO EXCITED PROC, MINIST EDUC SCI & CULTURE JAPAN
ID CHEMICAL-VAPOR-DEPOSITION; GROWTH; PB(ZR; TI)O3; OZONE
AB Growth of PbZrxTi1-xO3 (PZT) thin films was performed by photoenhanced metalorganic chemical vapor deposition (MOCVD), using Pb(C2H5)4, Zr(O-t-C4H9)4, Ti(O-i-C3H7)4, NO2 and O3.  When NO2 was used as an oxidizing gas, the observed photoirradiation effects were an increase in the growth rate, an increase in the Zr content in the films, a change in the ferroelectric properties and a decrease in leakage current densities.  When O3 was used, an increase in the growth rate was also observed.  When films were grown using O3 and UV + O3, the films showed better leakage current characteristics than the films grown using O2.
RP SHIMIZU, M (reprint author), KYOTO UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT ELECTR,SAKYO KU,KYOTO 606,JAPAN.

TI A DISTURBANCE SUPPRESSION CONTROL-SYSTEM FOR CAR-MOUNTED AND PORTABLE
   OPTICAL DISK DRIVES
SO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON CONSUMER ELECTRONICS
LA English
DT Article
AB This paper presents a new optical drive system incorporating acceleration disturbance suppression control in the focus actuator. The new system uses a disturbance observer based on modern control theory to provide a wide range of detection. As a result, it has achieved a significant improvement in control robustness from conventional systems.

TI BRILLOUIN-SCATTERING FROM SPIN-WAVES IN AN ULTRATHIN FE WEDGE
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 2nd Nishina International Conference on Optical Properties of
   Nanostructures
CY SEP 19-22, 1994
CL SENDAI, JAPAN
SP INOUE SCI FDN, SENDAI, IZUMI SCI & TECHNOL FDN
HO SENDAI INT CTR
DE BRILLOUIN SCATTERING; SPIN WAVE; ULTRATHIN FE WEDGE; SURFACE MAGNETIC
   ANISOTROPY
ID SURFACE-ANISOTROPY; FE(001)
AB Collective spin waves in an ultrathin epitaxial bcc Fe (001) wedge have been investigated using Brillouin scattering at room temperature. Spin wave frequencies were determined as a function of the external magnetic field for various Fe thicknesses ranging between 2.6 Angstrom and 8.9 Angstrom. We found that the stable direction of the magnetization of the wedge under zero magnetic field turns over from the in-plane direction to the surface normal below d approximate to 3 Angstrom.
C1 NATL INST ADV INTERDISCIPLINARY RES,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI RF ACCELERATION SYSTEM AT COOLER-SYNCHROTRON TARN-II
SO NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION A-ACCELERATORS
   SPECTROMETERS DETECTORS AND ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT
LA English
DT Article
AB An ion cooler-synchrotron TARN II has been constructed at INS. The RF acceleration system in this ring has a specification of wide frequency range, from 0.62 to 7.50 MHz, and of high sensitivity of beam monitoring devices for RF frequency control. With use of this RF acceleration system, beam acceleration has been successfully achieved for the light ion beams. In the present paper, the designed RF parameters including the beam feedback system, and the details of hardware for the RF system, are described as well as the experimental results of beam acceleration.

TI MAGNETOOPTICAL PROPERTIES OF FE-PT ALLOY-FILMS IN THE RANGE 1.55-10.5 EV
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID KERR ROTATION SPECTRA; PT/CO SUPERLATTICES; MULTILAYERED FILMS;
   CIRCULAR-DICHROISM; LAYERED STRUCTURES; TRANSITION-METALS; ANISOTROPY;
   CO/PT; DEPENDENCE; STORAGE
AB The optical and magneto-optical properties of as-deposited and annealed Fe51Pt49 films were investigated in the photon energy range 1.55-10.5 eV. The magneto-optical Kerr rotation (theta(K)) spectra of both films were found to show a dispersion-type structure in the 4.6-7.8 eV region: they have large negative and broad positive peaks at around 4.8 and 7.8 eV, respectively. The theta(K) spectra showed a tendency that is essentially quite similar to that of bulk Fe. The Kerr ellipticity (eta(K)) spectra are bell shaped, exhibiting a large negative peak at 6.3 eV. Plasma edges were observed at 6.9 eV for the as-deposited film and at 7.3 eV for the annealed film. The absolute value of the real part of the off-diagonal dielectric element (epsilon(XY)') of both films at approximately 4.8 eV are almost the same as that of bulk Fe. This leads to the conclusion that the theta(K) enhancement at 4.8 eV is mainly due to a decrease in epsilon(XX)'' and a peak shift in epsilon(XY)' towards lower energy, but not to a plasma-resonance effect.
C1 NIHON UNIV,COLL SCI & TECHNOL,FUNABASHI,CHIBA 274,JAPAN.
   ELECTROTECH LAB,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.
   NATL LAB HIGH ENERGY PHYS,PHOTON FACTORY,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI EFFECTS OF GROWTH-RATE ON PROPERTIES OF PB(ZR, TI)O3 THIN-FILMS GROWN BY
   CHEMICAL-VAPOR-DEPOSITION
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article
DE PB(ZR, TI)O3 FILM; CHEMICAL VAPOR DEPOSITION; GROWTH RATE; DIELECTRIC
   CONSTANT; FERROELECTRIC PROPERTIES; FILM ORIENTATION; GRAIN SIZE
AB The effects of the growth rate on the dielectric and ferroelectric properties are studied using tetragonal Pb(Zr, Ti)03 thin films grown by chemical vapor deposition. The growth rates of the films were controlled by changing the carrier flow rates and tank pressures for metallorganic sources. In particular, when the source tank pressures were changed, the growth rates were successfully controlled. The electrical properties of the films were dependent on the growth rate. With reduced growth rate, Pb(Zr, Ti)O3 films with higher dielectric constants and lower remanent polarizations were obtained. In order to clarify the cause of this effect, changes in the orientation and microstructures of the films were also investigated.
RP KATAYAMA, T (reprint author), KYOTO UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT ELECTR,SAKYO KU,KYOTO 606,JAPAN.

TI SWITCHING KINETICS OF PB(ZR, TI)O3 THIN-FILMS GROWN BY
   CHEMICAL-VAPOR-DEPOSITION
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article
DE POLARIZATION SWITCHING KINETICS; PB(ZR, TI)O3 THIN FILMS; CHEMICAL VAPOR
   DEPOSITION; SWITCHING TIME; SWITCHED CHARGE DENSITY; ELECTRODE AREA;
   PULSE VOLTAGE; DOMAIN NUCLEATION; TIME CONSTANT
AB The pulse switching kinetics of ferroelectric Pb(Zr, Ti)O3 thin films grown by chemical vapor deposition (CVD) has been investigated.  The switching time was proven to be proportional to the electrode area of the thin-film capacitor under our measurement conditions. Polarization switching was also characterized by the exponential functions of reciprocal voltage. On the basis of the experimental results, the relationships among the apparent switching phenomena, the nucleation process of reversed domains and the time constant of the measurement system are discussed. Moreover, the switching time determined by the low nucleation rate is formulated.
RP KATAYAMA, T (reprint author), KYOTO UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT ELECTR,YOSHIDA HONMACHI,SAKYO KU,KYOTO 606,JAPAN.

TI THIN-FILM GROWTH OF PB(ZR, TI)O3 BY PHOTOENHANCED METALORGANIC
   CHEMICAL-VAPOR-DEPOSITION USING NO2
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 10TH MEETING OF FERROELECTRIC MATERIALS AND THEIR APPLICATIONS ( FMA-10
   )
CY MAY 26-28, 1993
CL KYOTO, JAPAN
DE PHOTO-MOCVD; FERROELECTRIC PB(ZR, TI)O3 FILM; PHOTOIRRADIATION EFFECT;
   CRYSTALLINE STRUCTURE; GROWTH RATE; DIELECTRIC PROPERTIES; FERROELECTRIC
   PROPERTIES; LEAKAGE CURRENT DENSITY; STEP COVERAGE
ID MOCVD
AB Ferroelectric Pb(Zr, Ti)03 thin films were successfully grown by photoenhanced metalorganic chemical vapor deposition (photo-MOCVD), using Pb(C2H5)4, Zr(O-t-C4H9)4, Ti(O-i-C3H7)4 and NO2. Both tetragonal and rhombohedral Pb(Zr, Ti)O3 thin films were obtained at substrate temperatures higher than 535-degrees-C. Significant effects of photoirradiation on the growth behavior were observed. The observed effects included an increase in the growth rate and film compositional ratio of Zr/(Zr+Ti), and a change in the electrical properties. A decrease in the growth temperature of the Pb(Zr, Ti)O3 films caused by photoirradiation was observed only when the films were grown at low gas supply ratios of [Zr]/([Zr]+[Ti]). The photodeposited Pb(Zr, Ti)O3 films obtained showed good ferroelectric properties, good leakage characteristic and good step coverage.
RP SHIMIZU, M (reprint author), KYOTO UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT ELECTR,SAKYO KU,KYOTO 606,JAPAN.
CR ANDO A, 1992, JPN J APPL PHYS 1, V31, P3001, DOI 10.1143/JJAP.31.3001

TI RHEED INTENSITY OSCILLATIONS IN THE GROWTH OF AG/FE/AU AND AU/FE/AG(100)
   ARTIFICIAL SUPERLATTICES

LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 1ST INTERNATIONAL SYMP ON METALLIC MULTILAYERS ( MML 93 )
CY MAR 01-05, 1993
CL KYOTO, JAPAN
SP JAPAN INST MET, RES INST PROD DEV
ID ENERGY ELECTRON-DIFFRACTION; EPITAXY
AB Intensity oscillations of reflective high-energy electron diffraction (RHEED) were observed during UHV epitaxial growth of Fe/Au, Fe/Ag, Ag/Fe/Au and Au/Fe/Ag(100) superlattices. It is found that the stacking structure of all systems except Fe/Ag can be controlled using the RHEED intensity oscillation. Differences in the magnetic properties of these systems are discussed in terms of the growth mechanism of metallic multilayers.

TI OSCILLATION OF SATURATION MAGNETOOPTICAL KERR ROTATION IN EPITAXIAL
   FE/AU/FE AND FE/AG/FE(100) SANDWICHED FILMS
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 1ST INTERNATIONAL SYMP ON METALLIC MULTILAYERS ( MML 93 )
CY MAR 01-05, 1993
CL KYOTO, JAPAN
SP JAPAN INST MET, RES INST PROD DEV
ID QUANTUM-WELL STATES
AB We report on the behavior of saturation polar Kerr rotation (phi(K))-spectra and their oscillation due to interlayer thickness in Fe/Au/Fe and Fe/Ag/Fe sandwich films. A oscillation of phi(K) as a function of d was observed in the photon energy region between about 2.5 and 3.8 eV for Fe(6 angstrom)/Au(d angstrom)/Fe(6 angstrom) sandwiched films. The oscillation period was about 5ML (10 angstrom) of Au. Similar results were also observed in Fe/Ag/Fe films. The oscillation is thought to be closely related with the formation of spin polarized quantum well states of the DELTA1 band in Au layers sandwiched by magnetic layers.

CY MAR 01-05, 1993
CL KYOTO, JAPAN
SP JAPAN INST MET, RES INST PROD DEV
ID TRANSITION; CONSTANTS; NI
AB We report on the Kerr effects of ultrathin Fe films on Au or Ag (100) substrates. In 3.5-4.5 eV, a new phi(K) peak appears only in Fe/Au. The epsilon(xy) of Fe film below 8 angstrom deposited on Ag is different from that of bulk, and shows some structures in 2-3 eV. This is thought to be due to polarized Au atoms adjacent to Fe layer.

TI IMPORTANCE OF GLU-125 IN THE CATALYTIC ACTIVITY OF HUMAN RENAL
   DIPEPTIDASE
SO BIOCHIMICA ET BIOPHYSICA ACTA
LA English
DT Article
DE RENAL DIPEPTIDASE; ACTIVE SITE; SITE-DIRECTED MUTAGENESIS; CHEMICAL
   MODIFICATION
ID HUMAN MICROSOMAL DIPEPTIDASE; BETA-LACTAMASE ACTIVITY;
   DEHYDROPEPTIDASE-I; THIENAMYCIN; EXPRESSION; MEMBRANE; CLONING; SITE;
   PURIFICATION; SPECIFICITY
AB The carboxyl reagent N-ethoxycarbonyl-2-ethoxy-1,2-dihydroquinoline (EEDQ) and dansylethylenediamine have shown to inhibit human renal dipeptidase (hrDP) irreversibly in a time-dependent manner. Cilastatin, a competitive inhibitor of the enzyme, partially protected the enzyme from inactivation. To identify the site(s) modified by EEDQ and dansylethylenediamine, the amino-acid sequence of tryptic fragments of modified enzyme were analyzed extensively. A comparison of the determined amino-acid sequences with the predicted primary structure of hrDP revealed that Glu-125 within the Glu115-Arg138 fragment was modified. In consequence, the role of Glu-125 in catalytic activity was investigated by site-directed mutagenesis. Glu-125 was replaced by a glutamine, asparatic acid or cysteine residue. cDNAs for wild-type or mutated enzymes were expressed in CHO cells, and the resulting proteins were purified to apparent homogeneiety. The mutated enzyme, Gln-125-hrDP exhibited specific activity of 28.5 U/mg, corresponding to 11.4% of the wild-type. In contrast, Asp-125-hrDP and Cys-125hrDP were found to be inactive (less-than-or-equal-to 0.1% of wild-type enzyme). These results suggest that the polarity and/or length of the side chain of Glu-125 residue are important for the enzyme activity.

TI MAGNETOOPTICAL PROPERTIES OF AU/FE/AG AND AG/FE/AU(001) SANDWICH FILMS
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL SYMP ON MAGNETIC ULTRA THIN FILMS, MULTILAYERS AND
   SURFACES
CY SEP 07-10, 1992
CL LYON, FRANCE
SP EUROPEAN MAT RES SOC, MAT RES SOC, CNRS, PHILIPS RES, RIBER, SAGEM, TDK, LCR THOMSON CSF, TOSHIBA, UBE IND
HO ECOLE NORMALE SUPER LYON
AB Magneto-optical polar Kerr spectra of two monatomic layers of bcc-Fe (001), which were sandwiched by Au and Ag(001) layers, were investigated. A new peak appears in the off-diagonal conductivity spectrum at around 4 eV for the Fe layers grown on a Au surface. The new transition is tentatively attributed to the transition from the majority spin DELTA5 to the DELTA1 quantum well state.

TI AIR-FLOW ANALYSIS AROUND OUTDOOR UNITS OF AIR-CONDITIONERS USED IN A
   HIGH BUILDING - (EVALUATIONS OF A SHORT CYCLE BETWEEN INLET AND OUTLET)
SO JSME INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL SERIES B-FLUIDS AND THERMAL ENGINEERING
LA English
DT Article
DE HEAT TRANSFER; COMPUTATIONAL FLUID DYNAMICS; BUILDING WIND; AIR
   CONDITIONER; OUTDOOR UNIT; SHORT CYCLE BETWEEN INLET AND OUTLET
AB In recent years, outdoor units of air conditioners have tended to be set on veranda space on each floor of high-rise buildings. In this situation, it is probable that the intake outlet flows into the outdoor units of air conditioners directly because of atmospheric wind. This is called a short cycle between the inlet and outlet. Atmospheric wind problems around a high-rise building and inlet-outlet flows of outdoor units are solved numerically to investigate the influence of atmospheric wind upon the short cycle. The test building is only a short distance from neighboring buildings. Atmospheric wind is assumed to flow with a constant velocity in a constant direction. The results are compared with experimental data on real buildings to discuss differences between the analytical wind model and natural wind.
C1 MITSUBISHI ELECTR CO,SHIZUOKA WORKS,SHIZUOKA 422,JAPAN.

TI STUDIES ON MODIFICATION OF EPOXY-RESINS WITH SILICONE EPOXY
   BLOCK-COPOLYMER .2. EFFECTS OF THE ADDITION OF SILICONE BLOCK-COPOLYMER
   ON THE TOUGHNESS OF CURED EPOXY-RESIN MODIFIED WITH RTV-SILICONE
SO KOBUNSHI RONBUNSHU
LA Japanese
DT Article
DE TOUGHENING; EPOXY RESIN; SILICONE BLOCK COPOLYMER; INTERFACIAL TENSION;
   IMPACT STRENGTH
ID RUBBER
AB We tried to disperse stable RTV-silicone as fine particles in bisphenol-A type epoxy resin by the addition of silicone-epoxy block copolymer. The block copolymer acts as a strong surface-active agent in the silicone-modified epoxy resin. The size of the silicone phase decreased to lower than 1 mum with the addition of the block copolymer. The increase in the dispersability of silicone was explained by the decrease of the interfacial tension between the epoxy matrix and the silicone phase. Toughness of the modified resins increased with a decrease in the diameter of the silicone phase. In the region where the diameter of the dispersed phase is less than 1 mum, the impact strength of the modified system became higher than that of unmodified system.

TI PERFORMANCE ANALYSIS FOR A 2-CLASS PRIORITY QUEUING MODEL WITH GENERAL
   DECREMENTING SERVICE
SO IEICE TRANSACTIONS ON COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
DE GENERAL DECREMENTING SERVICE; PRIORITY QUEUE; 2-CLASS SERVICE
AB This paper investigates a two-class priority queue with decrementing service of a parameter (k1 = infinity, k2 = k, 1 less-than-or-equal-to less-than-or-equal-to infinity) which operates as follows: Starting once a class-1 message service, a single server serves all messages in queue 1 until it becomes empty. After service completion in queue 1, the server switches over to queue 2 and continues serving messages in queue 2 until either queue 2 becomes empty, or the number of messages decreases to k less than that found upon the server's arrival at queue 2, whichever occurs first. It is assumed that arrival streams are Poissonian, message service times are generally distributed, and switch-over times are zero. We derive queue-length generating functions and LSTs of message waiting time distributions.
RP KATAYAMA, T (reprint author), TOYAMA PREFECTURAL UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT ELECTR & INFORMAT,TOYAMA 93903,JAPAN.

TI A SIMPLE STATE-SPACE APPROACH TO SPECTRAL FACTORIZATION FOR
   DISCRETE-TIME SYSTEM
SO CONTROL-THEORY AND ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY
LA English
DT Article
DE SPECTRAL FACTORIZATION; INNER-OUTER FACTORIZATION; SYMPLETIC MATRIX;
   SCHUR DECOMPOSITION; RICCATI EQUATION
AB This paper is concerned with inner-outer/spectral factorizations appearing in discrete-time H-2 / H(infinity) optimal controls. We derive an algorithm for the inner-outer factorization of a stable transfer matrix, using the compact notation for the state-space representation of rational transfer matrices and the Schur decomposition of an associated symplectic matrix. The same technique is also employed for developing an algorithm of spectral factorization appearing in H(infinity) controls. Moreover, we extend the spectral factorization result to the case where the original transfer matrix is not necessarily stable. A numerical result is included.
RP KATAYAMA, T (reprint author), KYOTO UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT APPL MATH & PHYS,KYOTO 606,JAPAN.

TI EFFECTS OF THE REACTION PRESSURE ON THE GROWTH OF PBTIO3 THIN-FILMS BY
   THE PHOTOCHEMICAL VAPOR-DEPOSITION METHOD
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 9TH MEETING OF FERROELECTRIC MATERIALS AND THEIR APPLICATIONS ( FMA-9 )
CY MAY 27-29, 1992
CL TOKYO, JAPAN
DE PHOTO-CVD; PBTIO3 FILM; REACTION PRESSURE; DEPOSITION RATE; CRYSTALLINE
   STRUCTURE
AB Growth of PbTiO3 thin films was carried out by the photo-chemical vapor deposition (photo-CVD) method and by varying the growth parameters of substrate temperature, reaction pressure and UV light irradiation. In order to clarify the effects of these parameters on the thin film growth; a three-way-lay-out factorial experiment was done. In the higher temperature and pressure region the vapor phase reaction is dominant. At lower temperatures and pressures, the reaction on the substrate becomes significant. These tendencies were observed under conditions with and without UV light irradiation. The synthesis of PbTiO3 on Pt/sapphire was assisted by UV light irradiation.
C1 KYOTO UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT ELECTR,SAKYO KU,KYOTO 606,JAPAN.
RP ANDO, A (reprint author), MURATA MFG CO LTD,DEPT CERAM RES & DEV,2-26-10 TENJIN,NAGAOKAKYO,KYOTO 617,JAPAN.
