TI GROWTH OF PB(ZR, TI)O3 THIN-FILMS BY PHOTOENHANCED CHEMICAL
   VAPOR-DEPOSITION AND THEIR PROPERTIES
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 9TH MEETING OF FERROELECTRIC MATERIALS AND THEIR APPLICATIONS ( FMA-9 )
CY MAY 27-29, 1992
CL TOKYO, JAPAN
DE PHOTOENHANCED CVD; PB(ZR, TI)O3 FILM; PHOTOIRRADIATION; ZR/TI FLOW
   RATIO; TETRAGONAL AND RHOMBOHEDRAL PHASES; GROWTH RATE; FILM
   COMPOSITION; DIELECTRIC AND FERROELECTRIC PROPERTIES; SWITCHING
   CHARACTERISTICS; IV CHARACTERISTICS
AB Pb(Zr, Ti)O3 thin films were grown by photoenhanced chemical vapor deposition (CVD) using Pb(C2H5)4, Zr(O-t-C4H9)4, Ti(O-i-C3H7)4 and O2. Two types of perovskite Pb(Zr, Ti)O3 films (tetragonal films and rhombohedral films) were successfully obtained at 600-635-degrees-C by controlling the carrier flow ratio of the Zr source to Ti source. The Zr/Ti flow ratio also affected the growth rate, composition and electrical properties of films. In this study, it was proven that significant increases in both growth rate and Zr/Ti compositional ratio were caused by photoirradiation. Dielectric and ferroelectric properties, switching characteristics and I-V characteristics of the obtained Pb(Zr, Ti)O3 films were also described in detail.
RP KATAYAMA, T (reprint author), KYOTO UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT ELECTR,YOSHIDA HONMACHI,SAKYO KU,KYOTO 606,JAPAN.

TI PHASE-LOCKED EPITAXY AND STRUCTURAL-ANALYSIS OF FE/AU(100) ARTIFICIAL
   SUPERLATTICES
SO APPLIED SURFACE SCIENCE
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 1ST INTERNATIONAL SYMP ON ATOMICALLY CONTROLLED SURFACES AND INTERFACES
   ( ACSI-1 )
CY NOV 19-22, 1991
CL TOKYO, JAPAN
SP JAPAN SOC APPL PHYS
ID ENERGY ELECTRON-DIFFRACTION; RHEED INTENSITY OSCILLATION; METALLIC
   OVERLAYERS; GROWTH; FILMS; FE
AB By counting peaks of the reflection high-energy electron diffraction (RHEED) intensity oscillation, bcc-Fe/fcc-Au(100) superlattices were synthesized artificially. Using the Hendricks and Teller method, a statistical distribution of the superlattice periods is obtained from the X-ray diffraction pattern. A relation between fluctuations of superlattice periods, an interfacial alloying, and the irregular pattern of the RHEED intensity oscillations is discussed.
C1 NIHON UNIV,CHIBA 274,JAPAN.

TI PERFORMANCE ANALYSIS AND OPTIMIZATION OF A CYCLIC-SERVICE TANDEM QUEUING
   SYSTEM WITH MULTICLASS CUSTOMERS
SO COMPUTERS & MATHEMATICS WITH APPLICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
AB This paper analyzes a special single-server tandem queueing system with feedback, which appears in call processing for multi-class calls (tasks) in telecommunication systems. Explicit expressions are derived for joint queue-length generating functions and the mean total sojourn time spent by a call (task) in the tandem queueing system. Using the interchange argument and the extended Kleinrock's conservation law, an optimal task scheduling strategy (called as the K/h rule) is obtained to minimize a cost function defined by the individual mean total sojourn times of multi-class tasks.
RP KATAYAMA, T (reprint author), TOYAMA PREFECTURAL UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT ELECTR & INFORMAT,TOYAMA 93903,JAPAN.

TI MAGNETIC AND MAGNETOOPTICAL PROPERTIES OF SPUTTERED CO/PD MULTILAYERS
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 13TH INTERNATIONAL COLLOQUIUM ON MAGNETIC FILMS AND SURFACES ( ICMFS )
CY AUG 26-30, 1991
CL GLASGOW, SCOTLAND
HO GLASGOW UNIV
ID ANISOTROPY; PD/CO; COERCIVITY; LAYERS
AB Co/Pd multilayer thin films consisting of Co layers between 2-25 angstrom and Pd layers of typically 14 angstrom were prepared by rf sputtering. Hysteresis loops and the magnetization were measured parallel and perpendicular to the film plane. From these measurements and torque curves it was found that the multilayers show a transition of the easy. axis from an in-plane to a direction perpendicular to the film plane when decreasing the Co layer thickness below 10 to 6 angstrom depending on the sputter rate and sputter gas used (Ar or Kr). Below 4.5 angstrom Co layer thickness M(r)/M(s) is nearly one. The coercivity increases with decreasing Co layer thickness also depending on the sputter parameters used and the thickness of the seedlayer. The hysteresis loops measured with the Kerr-tracer did not show much difference with those measured with the VSM. Although TEM photographs show very clearly a layered structure when a seedlayer is used, low angle X-ray measurements seem to indicate sharper interfaces in multilayers where no or a very thin seedlayer is used. From the recording point of view the best results (high coercivity, squareness and anisotropy) were obtained by using Ar gas at high pressure.
RP DEHAAN, P (reprint author), UNIV TWENTE,MESA RES INST,POB 217,7500 AE ENSCHEDE,NETHERLANDS.
CR CARCIA PF, 1985, APPL PHYS LETT, V47, P178, DOI 10.1063/1.96254

TI NEW MAGNETOOPTICAL TRANSITION IN ULTRATHIN FE(100) FILMS
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID KERR ROTATION; SMOKE SIGNALS; FE; SURFACE; AG(100); FE/CU;
   SUPERLATTICES; ENHANCEMENT; MONOLAYERS; FE/AU(100)
AB Magneto-optical polar Kerr effects in ultrathin bcc Fe(100) films sandwiched by Au layers were investigated in the 1.6-5.3 eV photon energy range at room temperature. A new peak appeared in the off-diagonal conductivity spectrum at around 3.5-4.5 eV for the Fe films thinner than 10 angstrom. The peak energy is lower for thinner Fe films. The absolute value of epsilon(xy) at 3.7 eV in the 3 angstrom thick Fe film is 2 times as large as that in the bulk Fe.
C1 TOKYO UNIV AGR & TECHNOL,FAC TECHNOL,KOGANEI,TOKYO 184,JAPAN.

AU FUJITA, H

AF FUJITA, H
   KATAYAMA, T
TI INSITU OBSERVATION OF STRAIN-INDUCED GAMMA-S.RA-EPSILON-S.RA-ALPHA' AND
   GAMMA-S.RA-ALPHA' MARTENSITIC TRANSFORMATIONS IN FE-CR-NI ALLOYS
SO MATERIALS TRANSACTIONS JIM
LA English
DT Article
DE GAMMA[--]S.E-]ALPHA' TRANSFORMATION, GAMMA-S.RA-ALPHA' TRANSFORMATION;
   NUCLEATION OF ALPHA'-CRYSTALS, GROWTH PROCESS OF ALPHA'-CRYSTALS;
   IRON-CHROMIUM-NICKEL ALLOYS
AB Strain-induced gamma --> epsilon --> alpha' and gamma --> alpha' martensitic transformations in Fe-Cr-Ni alloys have been investigated by in-situ deformation with a high voltage electron microscope. The results obtained are summarized as follows: [A] gamma --> epsilon --> alpha' transformation: (1) Two sets of epsilon-crystals are formed along the primary and the conjugate slip planes in gamma-crystals oriented for multiple slip systems. Fine alpha'-crystals are frequently formed at the intersections between these epsilon-crystals. (2) In gamma-crystals oriented for a single slip system alpha'-crystals are also formed. In this case, cross-slip accompanying a stair-rod dislocation frequently occurs in local regions, and stacking faults corresponding to the secondary shear displacement are induced to form alpha'-crystals. (3) These alpha'-crystals grow to make coalescence with each other, and large alpha'-crystals are formed. [B] gamma --> alpha' martensitic transformation: (1) gamma --> alpha' transformation also occurs by "the double shear mechanism". (2) Formation processes of alpha'-crystals are classified into slow "Schiebung" type and rapid "Umklapp" type. The former is observed in gamma-grains oriented for a single slip system, and the latter in those oriented for multiple slip systems or in work-hardened gamma-grains. (3) In both cases, gamma-twins are always well formed prior to the formation of alpha'-crystals, and the secondary shear displacement is initiated at the interface of these gamma-twins. (4) Each alpha'-crystal grows easily along the gamma-twin plane.
   Nucleation and growth mechanisms of alpha'-crystals in these transformations are discussed on the basis of the experimental results.
C1 OSAKA UNIV,FAC ENGN,SUITA,OSAKA 565,JAPAN.
RP FUJITA, H (reprint author), KINKI UNIV,SCI & TECHNOL RES INST,HIGASHIOSAKA,OSAKA 577,JAPAN.

TI MAGNETOOPTICAL KERR ROTATION SPECTRA IN ORDERED AND DISORDERED PHASES OF
   FE-PT ALLOY-FILMS
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MAGNETISM
CY SEP 02-06, 1991
CL EDINBURGH, SCOTLAND
ID MULTILAYERED FILMS; CO/PT; ANISOTROPY
AB The magneto-optical Kerr rotation (theta(K)) spectra and the related properties have been measured in ordered and disordered phases of several kinds of Fe-Pt alloy films.  The \theta(K)\ in as-deposited (disordered) films becomes gradually larger with increasing Fe content until about 50 at% Fe, but the shape of theta(K) spectra does not change so much.  After annealing, however, all the theta(K) spectra were changed.  A considerable change of the theta(K) spectra near 300 nm, which would be expected by the anti-parallel alighment of the polarized Pt spins to Fe spins after annealing, was not observed in the films with approx. 50 at% Fe.

TI NMR-STUDY OF FCC CO/CU(100) AND CO/CU(111) ARTIFICIAL SUPERLATTICES
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MAGNETISM
CY SEP 02-06, 1991
CL EDINBURGH, SCOTLAND
AB Spin echo spectra of Co-59 nuclei in fcc Co/Cu superlattices were investigated.  The superlattices were prepared using the UHV deposition technique (10(-9) Torr during deposition).  (111) and (100) stacking structures were performed using Si(111) and MgO(100) single-crystal substrates.  The samples are essentially single crystals, but there are many stacking faults in the (111) oriented samples.  NMR spectra consist of some distinct lines corresponding to several local environments of Co nuclei in the superlattices.  Intensity and position of those lines show clear differences between two orientations.  The (100) stacked superlattices have rather rough interfaces, while the (111) stacked superlattices show NMR spectra of fairly flat interfaces.

TI TEMPERATURE-DEPENDENCE OF PERPENDICULAR MAGNETIC-ANISOTROPY IN CO/AU AND
   CO/PT MULTILAYERS
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MAGNETISM
CY SEP 02-06, 1991
CL EDINBURGH, SCOTLAND
ID FILM LAYERED STRUCTURES; SPIN ANISOTROPY; PD/CO
AB Temperature dependences of perpendicular magnetic anisotropy and saturation magnetization in Co/Au and Co/Pt multilayer films prepared by rf sputtering method were investigated.  The saturation magnetization, M(s), of the Co/Pt multilayer films is larger than M(s) of bulk Co at low temperatures.  Enhancement of M(s) is not observed in Co/Au multilayer films.  The magnetic anisotropy energy, K perpendicular-to eff, of Co/Au multilayer films increases greatly with decreasing temperature.  The K perpendicular-to eff at 5 K is four times as large as that at room temperature in the Co(4 angstrom)/Au(29.5 angstrom) multilayer film.  While K perpendicular-to eff in the Co/Pt multilayer films decreases with decreasing temperature.
C1 ELECTROTECH LAB,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI MAGNETIC AND TRANSPORT-PROPERTIES OF BAFEO3-Y
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MAGNETISM
CY SEP 02-06, 1991
CL EDINBURGH, SCOTLAND
AB We have measured the magnetic susceptibility at low fields by SQUID, the transport properties and the specific heat, in order to study the electronic state of BaFeO3-y.  We found that the quenching of the magnetic moment has a correlation with the transport properties.  In the low-temperature region the temperature dependence of the magnetization shows a spin-glass-like large thermal hysteresis and the resistivity becomes very large.

TI NOVEL NAPHTHALENE DERIVATIVES UNDERGOING THERMAL VALENCE ISOMERIZATION
   TO HEMI-DEWAR-NAPHTHALENE
SO CHEMISTRY LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID ISOMERS
AB 1,2,3-Tri-t-butyl-8-methyl- (1a), 1,2,3-tri-t-butyl-6-methyl-8-bromo- (1b), and 1,2,3-tri-t-butyl-8-bromo-naphthalene (1c) were synthesized.  They underwent thermally forbidden electrocyclic reaction to give hemi-Dewar-naphthalenes (2a,b,c).  Interconversion between 1 and 2 was thermally reversible.  Energy profiles for the reactions were determined.

TI ANALYSIS OF A PRIORITY QUEUE WITH BERNOULLI SCHEDULES
SO IFIP TRANSACTIONS C-COMMUNICATION SYSTEMS
LA English
DT Article
DE PRIORITY QUEUE; MULTICLASS SERVICE; BERNOULLI SCHEDULE; SET-UP TIME;
   CONSERVATION LAW
ID SERVICE QUEUES; SETUP TIMES; DECOMPOSITION; VACATIONS
AB This paper presents an analysis of a two-class priority queue (M/G/1 type queue) with Bemoulli schedules of parameter (p1=1, 1 greater-than-or-equal-to p2 greater-than-or-equal-to 0) and set-up times. The generating functions of joint queue-length distributions and the Laplace-Stieltjes transforms of waiting time distributions are determined. A closed-form expression with infinite summation is obtained for the mean waiting times. Kleinrock's conservation law is extended to the case that the set-up time may be dependent on the priority class.

TI MAGNETIC CIRCULAR-DICHROISM AT THE M2,3 EDGES IN 3-DIMENSIONAL
   TRANSITION-METALS AND THEIR COMPOUNDS
SO REVIEW OF SCIENTIFIC INSTRUMENTS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON SYNCHROTRON RADIATION INSTRUMENTATION
CY JUL 15-19, 1991
CL CHESTER, ENGLAND
ID X-RAY-ABSORPTION; 4D-CORE PHOTOABSORPTION; CE COMPOUNDS; SPECTRA; FE;
   NICKEL; IRON; 3D
AB The combined utilization of directly characterized off-plane circularly polarized synchrotron radiation and an ultrahigh-vacuum compatible superconducting magnet has enabled magnetic-circular-dichroism (MCD) experiments, mainly at the M2,3 core absorption edges.  Details concerning the experimental technique, which allowed quantitative MCD measurements, are described.  The results are presented and discussed for single crystals of Ni, Fe, and Fe3O4, and an Fe/Pt multilayer.

TI ORGANIC-DYES CO HYBRID DOUBLE LAYERED FILM
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article
DE KERR ROTATION ANGLE; DYE; MAGNETOOPTICAL DISK; COMPOSITIONALLY MODULATED
   MULTILAYER FILMS
AB A new enhancement method of Kerr rotation angle (theta(K)) is developed in a hybrid double layered film consisting of a magnetic layer and a dye layer. A strong enhancement is observed near the electron transition wavelength of an organic dye. The wavelength and the value of theta(K), enhancement do not depend on the thickness of the dye film at all. A magneto-optical disk using the structure is very interesting because the electron transition wavelength of an organic dye can be designed easily.
C1 ELECTROTECH LAB,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI PHOTO-MOCVD OF PBTIO3 THIN-FILMS
SO JOURNAL OF CRYSTAL GROWTH
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 7TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON VAPOUR GROWTH AND EPITAXY
CY JUL 14-17, 1991
CL NAGOYA, JAPAN
SP JAPANESE ASSOC CRYSTAL GROWTH, JAPAN SOC APPL PHYS, INT ORG CRYSTAL GROWTH
ID DEPOSITION
AB PbTiO3 thin films were deposited onto (0001) sapphire using the photo-MOCVD method.  Tetraethyl lead (Pb(C2H5)4) and titanium tetraisopropoxide (Ti(i-OC3H7)4) were used as a Pb and a Ti source, respectively.  In this study, NO2 was used as an oxidizing gas.  The structural nature and growth rate of PbTiO3 films depended on the substrate temperature, the flow rate of NO2 gas and photo-irradiation.  When the photo-irradiation was present during the growth run, perovskite PbTiO3 films were successfully grown at substrate temperatures above 530-degrees-C.  The dependence of the structural nature of the films on the irradiated light wavelength showed that the photochemical processes including the photolysis of NO2 effected the low temperature growth of PbTiO3.  The photo-deposited films showed higher growth rates than films obtained using the thermal MOCVD method at substrate temperatures below 550-degrees-C.  The electrical properties of the obtained films were also measured.
RP KATAYAMA, T (reprint author), KYOTO UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT ELECTR,YOSHIDA HONMACHI,SAKYO KU,KYOTO 606,JAPAN.
CR JONES ITN, 1973, J CHEM PHYS, V59, P4836, DOI 10.1063/1.1680696

TI THE ROLE OF OXYGEN DEFECTS IN SUPERCONDUCTIVITY OF ND2-XCEXCUO4-Y
   STUDIED BY X-RAY ABSORPTION FINE-STRUCTURE
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 3RD INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MATERIALS AND MECHANISMS OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
   : HIGH TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTORS
CY JUL 22-26, 1991
CL KANAZAWA, JAPAN
SP CITY KANAZAWA, ISHIKAWA PREFECTURE
AB The role of oxygen defects in superconductivity and their effect on the electron states has been studied by X-ray absorption fine structure on the Cu K and Ce L3 edges, for Nd2-xCexCuO4-y (0.0 < x < 0.20) annealed at various oxygen partial pressures (pO2 = 1-10(-4) atm).  The results indicate that the reduction enhances the electron density at the copper sites, without changing the oxygen deficiency y.  A possible mechanism of carrier enhancement through the removal of a small number of excess oxygen atoms which would suppress n-type doping in the CuO2 plane is presented.
RP OYANAGI, H (reprint author), ELECTROTECH LAB,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.
CR FORTUNE NA, 1991, PHYS REV B, V43, P12930, DOI 10.1103/PhysRevB.43.12930

TI SELECTIVE MONOALKYLATION AND MONOARYLATION OF DICHLOROBENZENES BY
   PALLADIUM-CATALYZED GRIGNARD CROSS-COUPLING
SO CHEMISTRY LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID ARYL HALIDES; ORGANIC HALIDES; REAGENTS; COMPLEX; CHLORIDES
AB Palladium(II)-phosphine complexes, especially PdCl2(dppf) where dppf stands for 1,1'-bis(diphenylphosphino)ferrocene, are effective catalysts for the cross-coupling of Grignard reagents with dichlorobenzenes to produce selectively mono-alkylated and arylated benzenes. The addition of ligands is also effective for the cross-coupling of Grignard reagents containing a beta-hydrogen(s).

TI REVISED INTERPRETATIONS OF ELECTRONIC SUBSTITUENT CONSTANTS USING
   ELECTRON NUMBER ANALYSIS AND MOLECULAR ELECTROSTATIC POTENTIAL
SO CHEMICAL & PHARMACEUTICAL BULLETIN
LA English
DT Article
DE ABINITIO MO METHOD; ELECTRON NUMBER; MOLECULAR ELECTROSTATIC POTENTIAL;
   SIGMA-INDUCTIVE EFFECT; FIELD EFFECT; SUBSTITUENT EFFECT; SUBSTITUENT
   CONSTANT; REGRESSION ANALYSIS
ID OXIDATION NUMBER; GROUND-STATES; PARAMETERS; CARBON; OXYGEN; FIELD
AB The substituent constants for sigma-inductive effect, called iota or sigma-chi, were reproduced by calculation using the Takano-Hosoya-Iwata electron number (THIEN).  The differences in electron numbers at a distance of R from a central atom were most effective in reproducing the sigma-inductive substituent constants, when R was set equal to 132.5 pm.  On the other hand, averaged molecular electrostatic potentials reproduced well the substituent constants for electronic field effects, called sigma-I or sigma-F.  These results indicate that the electronic substituent constants can be determined non-empirically by calculation based on quantum chemistry.
RP TAKAGI, T (reprint author), OSAKA UNIV,FAC PHARMACEUT SCI,1-6 YAMADA OKA,SUITA,OSAKA 565,JAPAN.

TI INSITU OBSERVATION OF THE STRAIN OF CO AND NI DEPOSITED ON PD(111) BY
   REFLECTION HIGH-ENERGY ELECTRON-DIFFRACTION
SO JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID PERPENDICULAR MAGNETIC-ANISOTROPY; MODULATED MULTILAYER FILMS;
   MAGNETOSTRICTION; STRESS; PD/CO; CO/PD
AB Co/Pd(111) and Ni/Pd(111) bilayer films were grown epitaxially on single crystal MgO (111) substrates by ultrahigh vacuum deposition.  In situ observation of the strain of Co and Ni deposited on Pd (111) plane was performed by reflection high energy electron diffraction (RHEED) during fabrication.  From RHEED patterns it was confirmed that the lattice constant of a Co film of 2 angstrom in thickness deposited on Pd was about 3.7 angstrom, which was different from that of Pd (3.89 angstrom).  The strain (epsilon-Co) of the Co layer was rapidly released during further Co deposition.  The strain epsilon-Co of the third Co monatomic layer on Pd is nearly equal to zero.  The large strain of the Co layer is localized at about one or two monatomic layers of the interface between Co and Pd.  On the other hand, a Ni film deposited on Pd was not strained from the beginning of the deposition.  The relationship between the perpendicular magnetic anisotropy of Co/Pd and Ni/Pd compositionally modulated multilayer films and the strain of Co and Ni is discussed.
C1 NIHON UNIV,COLL SCI & TECHNOL,FUNABASHI,CHIBA 274,JAPAN.
   ELECTROTECH LAB,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.
RP YAMAZAKI, T (reprint author), NIHON UNIV,COLL SCI & TECHNOL,FUNABASHI,CHIBA 274,JAPAN.

ID TARN-II; BEAM
AB An electron cooling device with a maximum energy of 110 keV was designed and constructed. TI GROWTH AND PROPERTIES OF PBTIO3 THIN-FILMS BY PHOTOENHANCED CHEMICAL
   VAPOR-DEPOSITION
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article
DE PHOTOENHANCED CVD; PBTIO3 FILM; UV LIGHT IRRADIATION; NO-2;
   LOW-TEMPERATURE GROWTH; PEROVSKITE STRUCTURE; DIELECTRIC LOSS FACTOR;
   RESISTIVITY; STEP COVERAGE
AB The photoenhanced chemical vapor deposition (CVD) of PbTiO3 thin films was carried out using tetraethyl lead, titanium tetraisopropoxide and nitrogen dioxide.  The use of NO2 and UV light irradiation during the growth run affected the crystalline quality and dielectric properties of films.  The photodeposited films with a perovskite structure were obtained on sapphire at substrate temperatures above 530-degrees-C.  In this study, it was found that the photodissociation of NO2 played an important role in decreasing the growth temperature.  The step coverage characteristics of films were also investigated.

TI NADP-DEPENDENT ALCOHOL-DEHYDROGENASE IN METHYLOSINUS-TRICHOSPORIUM
   (OB3B)
SO JOURNAL OF MOLECULAR CATALYSIS
LA English
DT Article
AB NADP-dependent alcohol dehydrogenase was partially purified from Methylosinus trichosporium (OB3b).  In this bacterium there were two kinds of alcohol dehydrogenases, PQQ-dependent and NADP-dependent dehydrogenases.  For NADP-dependent alcohol dehydrogenase, secondary alcohols were suitable substrates.

TI SOLUBILITIES OF PYRIMIDINE AND PYRAZINE DERIVATIVES IN SUPERCRITICAL
   FLUIDS
SO JOURNAL OF CHEMICAL AND ENGINEERING DATA
LA English
DT Article
AB Solid solubilities of three pyrimidine derivatives (2-chloropyrimidine, 4-hydroxypyrimidine, and 2-mercaptopyrimidine) and two pyrazine derivatives (2-aminopyrazine and pyrazine-2-carboxylic acid) in supercritical carbon dioxide, ethylene, ethane, and trifluoromethane were measured at 308.15 K.  In the high-pressure range, the solubilities in supercritical trifluoromethane are fairly large; it shows the strongest dissolution power for some of the solids investigated.  The solubilities in ethylene and ethane are somewhat low and show a weak pressure dependence for all substances.  In the case of carbon dioxide, there would be an interrelation between the solubilities of these derivatives and the electronic properties of the substituent involved.  All the substances except 2-chloropyrimidine are expected to be self-associated; thus, the solubilities are fairly small, especially the solubilities of pyrazine-2-carboxylic acid in ethylene and ethane, which are smaller than 10(-6) in mole fraction.
C1 OSAKA UNIV,FAC ENGN SCI,DEPT CHEM ENGN,TOYONAKA,OSAKA 560,JAPAN.

TI SERODIAGNOSIS OF HEPATITIS-C VIRUS (HCV) INFECTION WITH AN HCV CORE
   PROTEIN MOLECULARLY EXPRESSED BY A RECOMBINANT BACULOVIRUS
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE NATIONAL ACADEMY OF SCIENCES OF THE UNITED STATES OF
   AMERICA
LA English
DT Article
DE NON-A, NON-B HEPATITIS; ELISA; EARLY DIAGNOSIS; BLOOD SCREENING
ID NON-B-HEPATITIS; NON-A; HEPATOCELLULAR-CARCINOMA; JAPANESE PATIENTS;
   CONTROLLED TRIAL; INTERFERON-ALFA; ANTIBODIES; GENOME; CDNA; PREVALENCE
AB An enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) was developed for serological diagnosis of hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection, using HCV core protein (p22) synthesized by a recombinant baculovirus.  Among 58 clinically well-defined chronic non-A,  non-B hepatitis (NANBH)  patients, 49 (84.5%) were positive for p22 antibody (anti-p22), whereas 42 (72.4%) were positive for C100-3 antibody (anti-C100-3), as measured by the present assay using the HCV nonstructural protein as antigen.  Thirty-nine patients (67.2%) had both antibodies.  No significant level of anti-p22 was detected in sera of chronic hepatitis B patients or normal blood donors.  In typical post-transfusion NANBH patients, anti-p22 could be detected at, or even before, the first alanine aminotransferase peak.  Anti-p22 was also detected in blood donors who were previously shown to be involved in transmitting HCV but in whose serum anti-C100-3 was not detectable.  The ELISA detecting antibody to the HCV core protein expressed and properly processed in animal cells will be useful for mass screening of donor blood as well as for early diagnosis of hepatitis C.

TI FLUX-DENSITY DISTRIBUTION IN YBA2CU3OX THIN-FILMS DETERMINED BY USE OF
   THE FARADAY-EFFECT IN IRON-GARNET FILMS
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE Y-BA-CU-O; FARADAY ROTATION; GARNET FILM; CRITICAL CURRENT DENSITY;
   MAGNETIZATION
AB The flux penetration and trapping behavior in superconducting YBa2Cu3O(x) films have been observed quantitatively by means of the magnetooptical Faraday effect in iron garnet films with perpendicular magnetization.  The mazelike domain pattern of the iron garnet film placed on the superconducting film is affected by the flux in the superconducting film and is observed using a polarizing microscope.  Bi- and Ga-substituted YIG films grown by the liquid-phase epitaxy (LPE) method provide suitable characteristics at low temperature for this technique.  Flux density profiles are obtained quantitatively for the disk-shaped YBa2Cu3O(x) film.  The critical current density is also determined from the profiles.

TI PREPARATION OF POLYCRYSTALLINE BI3FE5O12 GARNET-FILMS
SO JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 35TH ANNUAL CONF ON MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
CY OCT 29-NOV 01, 1990
CL SAN DIEGO, CA
SP AMER INST PHYS, IEEE, MAGNET SOC, AMER INST MIN MET & PETR ENGINEERS, MET SOC, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, AMER SOC TESTING & MAT, AMER PHYS SOC, AMER CERAM SOC
ID MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES
AB Polycrystalline films of nonthermodynamical garnet Bi3Fe5O12 were synthesized by direct epitaxial growth from the vapor phase.  Polycrystalline thin layers of various kinds of thermodynamical garnets prepared on fused quartz substrates were employed as the substrate materials.  The saturation magnetization of the film grown onto the polycrystalline GGG layer was 140 mT at 5 K.  The films showed quite large magneto-optical effects.  In the film on the GGG layer, the Faraday rotation angle at a wavelength of 633 nm was - 5.5 deg/mu-m and the magneto-optical Kerr rotation angle at 455 nm was -0.9-degrees.

TI PERPENDICULAR MAGNETIC-ANISOTROPY IN PT/FE MULTILAYERS
SO JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 35TH ANNUAL CONF ON MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
CY OCT 29-NOV 01, 1990
CL SAN DIEGO, CA
SP AMER INST PHYS, IEEE, MAGNET SOC, AMER INST MIN MET & PETR ENGINEERS, MET SOC, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, AMER SOC TESTING & MAT, AMER PHYS SOC, AMER CERAM SOC
ID LAYERED STRUCTURES; CO/PT; FILMS
AB Perpendicular magnetic anisotropy (K-perpendicular-to) and related magnetic properties in Pt/Fe multilayers [compositionally modulated multilayer films (CMFs)] are investigated.  It is found that Pt/Fe CMFs with about an 18-angstrom Pt layer and Fe layer below 5 angstrom become perpendicularly magnetized films.  Surface magnetic anisotropy (K(s)) and volume anisotropy (K(v)) are 0.46 erg/cm2 and about - 2 x 10(7) erg/cm3 at room temperature, respectively.  The K(s) is almost equivalent to that of Pt/Co CMFs and increases with decreasing temperature.  The absolute value of K(v), however, is much larger than that of the Pt/Co system.  The effective magnetic anisotropy (K-perpendicular-to-eff) of [Fe(4.7 angstrom)/Pt(18.5 angstrom)]80 CMF changes from positive to negative at T congruent-to 200 K with decreasing temperature.

TI EFFECT OF REDUCTION ON SUPERCONDUCTIVITY AND ELECTRONIC STATE OF
   ND-CE-CU-O SYSTEM
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE SUPERCONDUCTOR; ND2-XCEXCUO4-DELTA; MAGNETIZATION; X-RAY ABSORPTION
ID CHARGE-CARRIERS
AB The effect of reduction on the superconductivity and electronic state of Nd2(-x)Ce(x)CuO4-6-delta has been investigated by measurements of the magnetization and X-ray absorption near-edge structure of the Cu K-edge for specimens annealed at various oxygen pressures and temperatures.  The superconducting onset temperature and diamagnetization increase with decreasing oxygen partial pressure of annealing.  We find that the electron density estimated from the edge shift of the Cu K-edge absorption increases with the increase in the degree of reduction and that the magnitude of superconductive diamagnetization becomes constant above a certain degree of reduction.  It is concluded that the electron density beyond a certain critical value is necessary for the occurrence of the superconductivity in this system.
C1 MEIJI UNIV,FAC SCI & TECHNOL,KAWASAKI 214,JAPAN.

TI CDNA-DERIVED AMINO-ACID-SEQUENCE OF L-HISTIDINE DECARBOXYLASE FROM MOUSE
   MASTOCYTOMA P-815 CELLS
SO FEBS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE HISTIDINE DECARBOXYLASE; MASTOCYTOMA P-815 CELL; AMINO ACID SEQUENCE;
   CDNA SEQUENCE; DOPA DECARBOXYLASE; POLYMERASE CHAIN REACTION
ID DOPA DECARBOXYLASE; MOLECULAR-CLONING
AB The primary structure of L-histidine decarboxylase (HDC:  L-histidine carboxy-lyase, EC 4.1.1.22) from mouse mastocytoma P-815 cells has been determined by parallel analysis of the amino acid sequence of the protein and the nucleotide sequence of the corresponding cDNA.  HDC contains 662 amino acid residues with a molecular mass of 74017, which is larger by about 21 000 Da than that of the previously purified HDC subunit (53 kDa), suggesting that HDC might be posttranslationally processed.  The HDC cDNA hybridized to a 2.7 kilobase mRNA of mastocytoma cells.  Homology was found between the sequences of mouse mastocytoma HDC and fetal rat liver HDC.
